Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location, Even Great Weather !”
Reviews.Author: Highbidder
Reviews.Content: This central hotel is convenient to the rail sation at Back bay just a few minutes walk. It is also close to the centre of Boston and the Park known as Boston Common, yet it is quiet and wholesome. The staff are genuinely friendy and very helpful. Complimentary Tea / Coffee service in the morning and wine service in the afternoon. ! The rooms are cosy and well appointed. A little problem we had was ably dealt with by Buck, the manager on duty at the time to our satisfation without any fuss or bother. The hotel is great value when all matters are factored in which I have no doubt in recommending to anyone. The weather for our stay was like summer time in mid March which added to the wonderful break.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Tressan Q
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I've stayed at this hotel. For the past 10 years, I've come to Boston to celebrate St. Patrick’s Day and have stayed at various locations... when I found this one last year, I can't imagine staying anywhere else. The location is super easy to get to off 90 and they have valet parking. Last year we did self park (there is a Marriott across the street that offers garaged parking) but this year we did the valet mostly because we were staying longer and had more luggage - didn't want to have to drag it across the busy intersection. I think the valet parking cost an extra $5 or $10... not too bad. Upon parking the vehicle, the doorman came out to greet us immediately and escorted us in while offering to help with our bags. Check in took all of three minutes and they were able to accommodate our request for a room on a high floor (6th floor our of 7, pretty good). There are two elevators... one is tiny with a narrow doorway. There is another one that is a little further past the tiny one that doesn't seem to be used a lot - this one is good when hauling bags! The common hallways are very wide and beautifully decorated but the rooms are small. But I expect this with a boutique hotel. We had a room with two double beds (SUPER COMFY), a rather large closey, and a decent sized bathroom. In fact, the closet was so large, it makes you wonder why they didn't incorporate some of that space into the regular room. But again, its a boutique hotel so I think they are limited with the placement of the walls - the building is pretty old. In the evening a housekeeper came to drop off a couple of (complimentary) water bottles. The room had a large Poland Spring bottle for sale at $5... Shaws next door was selling the saem size for $0.83. The complimentary bottles and the Shaws bottles were good enough for us! Checking out was just as easy - the valet parking was added to the hotel bill. They tell you it may take 15-20 minutes to bring your car around but it seems to be much less for mine. I did notice my car was pretty filthy... it was raining the day we checked in and it looked like it was under something dripping dirty rain water. It rubbed right off when I touched it so it didn't concern me - I think when you're parking in a city garage things like this are to be expected. The location just cannot be beat. There are T stations within walking distance and Boyleston and Newbury street are only a couple blocks away. Lots of shopping and pubs! I will definitely recommend this hotel to others and will be staying again and again. Thanks Copley Square Hotel staff for making this another truly successful St. Patricks Day weekend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Charles A
Reviews.Content: Great Decor,Awesome Rooms, Friendly Staff, Clean, Convenient and Complimentary Wine in the lounge every night 5-6pm! Couldn't ask for more!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: Catw93
Reviews.Content: I could go on about this place, so I'll just point out a few things. The rooms are small but so nice. The bed is great, and the staff are incredibly friendly. There is a very lively bar downstairs which is also wonderful, and the hotel just has a very good ambiance

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, amazing commitment to customer service”
Reviews.Author: A G
Reviews.Content: I don't write a lot of reviews, but this place inspired me to. Just stayed here during a massive blackout (March 2012) when the entire Back Bay lost power for 36 hours because a transformer exploded in the nearby Hilton. I can't say enough about the staff and general manager, they went WAY above and beyond to take care of everybody. I was there for a conference, but had brought my girlfriend with me, and we were just walking up to the entrance when every building downtown lost power. Minutes after the power went out, they offered my girlfriend and me (free) glasses of red wine as we were waiting in the dark to check in. Most of the guests could not get key cards made due to the power loss, so the staff would walk us to our rooms and open the door for us every time. The rooms are equal or higher quality compared to the other high-end hotels in the area, but the hotel is small enough that they are able to give a personal touch that you don't get at the Westin or Sheraton. They have a great restaurant and bar as well, which continued to serve throughout the blackout. Also, when the power hadn't come back on after 18 hours, they helped people book rooms in other other hotels that had power. I told them I felt bad leaving early after they took such good care of us, but that I would definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED MY STAY AT THE COPLEY SQUARE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PRRUFFRIDER
Reviews.Content: I must say that my stay at the Copley Square was magnificent. The staff were exceptionally knowledgable of the area and very accommodating for any special requests. The rooms and hotel itself was fashionably decorated and very clean. I would definitely recommend and most definitely be a return customer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluizgirl
Reviews.Content: My daughter, her friend and I stayed at the Copley Square Hotel last weekend. I booked the trip through a discount website, so when we three checked in, the front desk person told us that only a small queen room is generally what the discount website buys. However, he was very kind and upgraded us to a larger king room and we paid a little extra for a rollaway bed. It was a very comfortable room, nicely decorated with a small bathroom. But we managed to get ready each day. The wine reception in the evening is a nice touch. I stay in Chicago a lot and have enjoyed that feature at several hotels there. The hotel has a restaurant on site, however, we didn't get a chance to eat there. There is also a bar-called the MiniBar; convenient after a tiring day of shopping. Speaking of shopping--you can't go wrong staying at the Copley Square Hotel. It is very convenient to Prudential Center and Copley Place Mall nearby. It is also close to Newbury Street--well, you get the picture--lot's of shopping around. Restaurants abound everywhere, so you certainly won't starve! My daughter and her friend even walked to the movie theater one night to see a movie. I loved the ambiance of the hotel-small and quaint. The staff was very attentive and always greeted us warmly. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone is extremely friendly and the hotel is perfect accommodations for historical Boston.”
Reviews.Author: kaa13
Reviews.Content: We loved it! Perfect accommodations for an overnight getaway! The staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. We would highly recommend the hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: khb75
Reviews.Content: We live in the Boston suburbs and had a night away recently at the Copley Square Hotel. We got a great rate through hotwire and were thrilled with our choice. The hotel has recently been renovated and the lobby, bar, and rooms are really chic and elegant. It is historic Boston charm with a modern twist. We took an interior room which has a bigger bathroom and is very quiet. If you aren't there for a view, I totally recommend this. The bed was great, shower was large, and we even had a chandelier in the room. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel In Back Bay, MA”
Reviews.Author: NycPhoto5
Reviews.Content: Came here for Business, but will be back for my own personal stay. Close to the station and many other fun places. Back Bay is a great neighborhood and has many places to eat & drink. This stylish hotel had amazing service, clean, and a great price. The room was perfect and the bed was so fluffy. A must Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: CTEllie
Reviews.Content: I booked the Copley Square Hotel on Hotwire at the last minute. I go to Boston frequently for business and pleasure and have stayed at many of the chain hotels. I must say this place is a little gem, and was a refreshing change from the chains. Location is great, staff is personable and professional. Great value. The lobby area is cozy and comfortable. My room was a little on the small side, but very clean and comfortable. Bathroom had nice towels and a great shower (hard to find sometimes in the city!). The happy hour is a nice touch and I chatted with some fun people while enjoying a glass of wine before dinner. I will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, very attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: G K
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Staff very accommodating, they are sincere and care about my experience. The room was very comfortable. I actually sleep through the night. Bed very comfortable. My favorite spot to stay in boston

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Boston”
Reviews.Author: fishmart22
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at the Copley Square Hotel recently. It was clean, nicely updated and although we had booked a standard room through Priceline we opted to pay an additional $10 to upgrade to a larger room and it was well worth the money. Staff was friendly and helpful. There was a wine happy hour each day from 5-6 which was unexpected and fun. The fitness room was small but there were few people using it so it worked out fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SJB1209
Reviews.Content: A great location in the middle of the Back Bay Copley area. Just a minute from the Prudential centre and Shaw's supermarket. Hotel is very nice with attentive staff. Free internet access was a bonus when many Boston hotels charge extra. Although no coffee in the room there is free coffee in the lobby in the morning, hot chocolate in the afternoon and free wine from 5pm till 6pm ! Housekeeping were helpful and worked around our schedule. Very happy overall.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate & perfectly placed for business & pleasure”
Reviews.Author: SamirShivani
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for several weeks on a business trip Location: It's a 5 min walk from 2 metro lines (Orange line and Green line). 15 min walk from the waterfront. 15 min walk from frog pond ice-skating rink. A huge shopping complex right across. A grocery store 2 min away. Bustling shopping streets in vicinity. Lots of eating options around. You can't ask for more. Inside: Rooms are moderately sized but look fresh. Beds are comfortable, and interiors soothing & up-market. The gym is small but I never found it crowded. Housekeeping is efficient, reception staff helpful. I give 4 stars and not 5 because it's a little pricey and rooms aren't huge. And don't expect plush gardens, swimming pools etc within the property, or in any other in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value! Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravellerEire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in early Feb. Rooms are small but well equipped. Evening wine service is great! (Complimentary wine from 5-6pm.) Hotel has a modern funky vibe. Reception was efficient and friendly (New ENgland style.) SUCH A GREAT LOCATION. Right next to the Lenox Hotel on Boylston. We used the valet car park. 43USD per night. Sounds expensive however you can take and leave your car in as many times as you want. The Copley Parking next door is a public parking facility which costs 35USD per day and you have to leave car there whole time otherwise youhave to take a new ticket and pay again! Our flight didn't leave until 9pm. The hotel stored all our luggage and let us return for the wine service that evening. Great bar in hotel as well - 'Minibar'. Would definitely return. Negative point - lifts a little slow. Got a fantastic rate on Hotwire.com. More than half price of their best available rates on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - What to Expect”
Reviews.Author: Howard Y
Reviews.Content: This is more a compilation of different thoughts: I have to balance everything because the price of the hotel stay was very reasonable, in fact I thought it was a very good deal. The GOOD: It's a really central location, right on Copley Square and is on the same block as Sorellina, one of the best modern Italian restaurants I've been to in a long time. The rooms were modern and clean. The internet is complimentary, which I appreciated as a business traveler. The staff was very courteous. The not-so-GOOD: The elevator door was one of the smallest I've seen for a commercial building. Plus, there is only one. I was on the 6th floor, but I took stairs most of the times if there was a wait. It was a personal choice to get a little bit of exercise. My view happened to be of an alley and the building right across the backstreet. But since it was a business trip, I didn't mind much. Also, the valet is quite expensive, over $40 per night. I should've just cabbed it everywhere. All that said, I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Boston Marathon”
Reviews.Author: ryanleeh
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 days around the marathon. wonderful hotel. Staff was great. nice and attentive. room was very clean, and nicely decorated. but the room was very small. see pics. Free wine in the evening was nice. Brought ours to the room and hung out. went to the bar after the race. this is central to everything Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Copley Square Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marie32
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel in the best location in the Back Bay. A great alternative to the big chain hotels in the same neighborhood. It has so much more character, and is much easier to get in and out, i.e. no traversing through a huge lobby and waiting for elevators. The service is outstanding, and they have a fun free happy hour in the lobby with wine. Also a very cute and lively bar. The rooms are really nicely appointed, but it is an older building that has been converted, so there are quirks. Some of the rooms have teeny, tiny bathrooms. We opted for a larger room with a larger bathroom, but it was freezing, especially in the bathroom. They brought up a space heater which helped. We will definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “just ok. terrible coffee! so bad it's offensive”
Reviews.Author: NycSharona
Reviews.Content: hotel is nicely designed and some staff are nice but some are cold and arrogant. rooms are tiny and so are the bathrooms. coffee in lobby in morning is the worste! it is cold and watery and does not taste like coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Capeshmitty
Reviews.Content: I try to write useful reviews that you may find useful for planning your trip. So I hope this information helps you in planning a trip to Boston. This hotel is located in the Copley Plaza area near the Pru Center. It is very convenient to the Green T stop and plenty of shopping, dining and close enough to Fenway. There is a large parking garage across the street at the Marriott that charges $35 per night to park. You may want to weigh your options to self park there vs. valet. The hotel is not much to look at from the street. It's small and missing a few letters from the marquee. Don't let that scare you. The staff is VERY friendly. From bellmen, to front desk and wait staff. The elevators are small and the hotel has the feel of an older hotel like Britain or old NYC. I think it was built in the 1800's. But it's very clean and cute. The rooms are smallish but have everything you need. The bed is very comfortable. The rooms are dark and quiet. Perfect for sleeping late. The bath room is clean and well appointed with Taccoro products. I booked my room on Priceline and got a VERY good deal. I think this is a better option than the Marriott or Westin, where you might get a larger room but you are just paying for the name. The service here was great. I'd recommend it highly and I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Mainers-on-vacation
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Copley Square for our 25th anniversary. The staff were very friendly and considerate and made a point of providing many extra touches to ensure that our occasion would be special. We really appreciated our stay and definitely recommend this hotel on the basis of its staff, comfortable bed, and convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled service”
Reviews.Author: cydnanyc
Reviews.Content: Had great service. Arrived for business. Was offered a glass of wine. Was helped with restaurant recommendations. My room was small, but that was expected. Room was exceptionally clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Aleeha D
Reviews.Content: It was a nice hotel, liked the ambiance and the furniture of the room. Cute toilet. Really liked it, I was attending Harvard Summer School and stayed here for two days, enjoyed my stay. Really liked the iPod/iPhone Dock/Radio/Alarm

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - highly recommend - stay here”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Copley Square hotel. I was very impressed with the hotel and recommend it to anyone staying in Boston. The staff was one of the most helpful and kind group of people I have ever interacted with - they did all they could to make our stay great. The room was perfect and the location was amazing. I look forward to staying at the hotel in the future. It was perfect for individuals, couples, and families. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are small, but the experience is great”
Reviews.Author: dannyb33
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a recomendation when I had an extra day traveling during a work event. It was recomended by my wife because she had stayed here as well a year prior and loved it. Its a "boutique" style hotel so the rooms are small and quaint, but this is not the hotel you book to hang out in your room all day long. Upon entering the hotel, the service is great, prompt service by the valet and bellman. The receptionist was extremely friendly and explained all of the features of the Hotel including the manager hour/wine tasting that was going on later in the evening. I did not eat at the restaurant because by the time I got settled it was a bit late but I did eat at the bar. I only got an appetizer, but it was great. the bar service was pretty good, the bartenders actually talked to you, which they dont always do when you are by yourself at some bars. Later in the evening a great DJ started playing music, not dance music, more like "chill" style house music, perfect for the setting. I would recomend anyone to this hotel if you are looking for a unique experience and not the normal boring chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thayer1974
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel for 3 nights over MLK weekend. It was fantastic from top to bottom. I would absolutely go back (even though we normally like to try different hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Free Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: Alfonso W
Reviews.Content: Great location! Accessible to the T stops, the Prudential center (tons of shops), restaurants and bars. Rooms are clean and well maintained, however would spend extra for the king size bed. The rooms with the queen size bed are very small. Staff was friendly and attentive, and the rooms were very clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Cute”
Reviews.Author: roadtrip21
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great, right by Newbury street and the Mall if you want to go shopping, easy to get to Fenway by taking the T. However, the restaurant Xhale was nothing to speak of, our service was terrible and the food wasn't great either. The rooms are small and the layout is unique but it is a boutique. Very clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in a great n-hood.”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterrr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business, and it was great. Nice people, and nice room. My room was clean and comfortable, although the bathrooms are rather small, they do the job. Nice bath amenities and there is a one hour happy hour from 5-6 with free glasses of wine. On the first night I tried the restaurant and it was pretty good. Attentive staff made me feel welcome dining alone. I read lots of complaints about noise but I never heard any. This is a sweet jewel of a hotel in the back bay area of boston. I would totally stay here again. Centrally located to lots of shopping and dining. Neighborhood is great. Would recommend to anyone who travels a lot and has high standards.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very small rooms & beds”
Reviews.Author: rachel a
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern & clean. The downside is that the rooms are quite small & the rooms with queen size beds have smaller than normal queens. The queen beds are closer to a full size, so if you are tall get a king bed room. Good value for sure, but not good for more than a night or so given the tiny room size!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: johng1974
Reviews.Content: I live in boston and had to stay here for 1 night while I was doing some home renovations. The hotel is in the best possible location in Boston. In addition to its great location, the hotel has great bars, nightclub and restaurant that I frequent as a local. The staff was very friendly when I checked in, my reservation was for a standard room with a guaranteed upgrade to a king deluxe if available. Unfortunately the upgrade was not available and I was assigned to room 806, this was the smallest room I have ever stayed in, smaller than the Hudson in NYC, smaller than a cruise ship cabin. Luckily I was alone, there was no way it would have worked for 2 people, in addition to the tiny size of the room, the furniture was to much and way oversized, I could not move in the room without banging into something. Other than the size the room was tastefully appointed and quiet. This is a great hotel, but I would make sure that you book an upgraded room.

Reviews.Title: “Quality”
Reviews.Author: Happyman374
Reviews.Content: Service, spotless rooms, great location are top priority when I travel. This hotel meets all these needs.The staff is first class.

Reviews.Title: “little gem”
Reviews.Author: jgrock
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here. Rooms are clean, nicely decorated, and have comfortable beds. The wine hour is a nice touch and the Minibar lounge has great drinks and delicious appetizers. Hotel is close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Larklight
Reviews.Content: Great location in Boston and relatively okay price (offer on hotels.com, I think). We checked in at about 5pm and were greeted by wine (they offer this nightly between about 5 and 6)! Nice hotel room and bathroom. Not huge, but big enough and nice decorated in a modern style. Free coffee in the morning and iced tea in the afternoon. Located near transport links, but it is also possible to walk to e.g. Boston Common. Some ncie restaurants nearby. The Boston Library is also close and has to be one of the most beautiful public libraries I've ever seen (it's worth going in for a look). Staff are very helpful. Would definitely recommend and would certainly stay here again if had the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Underrated boutique hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Bostonner
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several hotels in Boston over the years, but for some reason had overlooked the Copley Square Hotel. My mistake. After staying in local chain hotels around the area, this is a nice change of pace from the generic standard hotels. The Copley Square Hotel offers a combination of historical charm and modern decor. It is true that the rooms are on the smaller side, but the bathrooms are spacious in comparison. My only complaint was that the room smelled a little musty when I arrived, but I left the window open while I went out and it aired out.There is valet parking available and you can also park across the street at the Copley mall, which could be more affordable in some cases. I will stay here again, especially since they offer several discount rates throughout the year and it is a good value for the location in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, really nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Vermonter05070
Reviews.Content: Copley Square Hotel is in a terrific location, the rooms are lovely, and the staff are incredibly nice. They offer complimentary coffee and hot chocolate all day, and a cocktail hour (free wine) in the evenings. It's a really nice touch, and people gather in the lounge and visit with each other while having a drink. I haven't had an experience like that in a US city before. I also had dinner via the bar, since the weather outside was terrible and the restaurant was closed for a private function. The food was terrific and the atmosphere in the bar was fun without being completely crazy.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: spedy1
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here on a quick getaway with my wife. The main draw is the location- literally a one-minute walk to Copley Place/Prudential Center malls. Two minute walk to Boylston and Newbury Streets. Definitely can't beat this location! In terms of the actual hotel- very courteous staff. The valet, concierge, and other staff were all friendly and helpful. In the reservation notes I mentioned that we were there to celebrate a birthday and upon check-in, my wife was handed a birthday card hand signed by the hotel staff. It was a nice touch that I doubt would have happened anywhere else. I would agree with the other reviews I've read- the rooms are...tiny. Not small, but tiny. That's not to say that our room wasn't tastefully decorated and very clean. I imagine most folks will spend their time wandering around Boston but if you are planning to spend a considerable amount of time in your hotel room, I would think twice before staying here. Following suit, the bathroom was tiny as well. Again, not a deal breaker but if you're claustrophobic, the bathroom will definitely throw you for a loop. With a hotel this small, noise also become an issues. The hallways are about 3 feet wide so you can hear other people entering/exiting their rooms. There is also a club inside the hotel and even on the 5th floor (out of 8), we could hear people laughing and carrying on at 1am. It really comes down to preference- if you don't mind paying a little extra (plus $40+ for parking) to stay smack dab in the middle of Back Bay and avoid unnecessary travel time to/from the city, this place works great. If, however, you're looking for a hotel with big rooms, a spacious parking lot, and absolute quiet, you should probably stay somewhere outside the city and drive/cab it.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms but perfect location”
Reviews.Author: alsaBoston
Reviews.Content: The hotel is super cute and modern. Beds were really comfortable. Great bars in the hotel. The location right in Copley Square can't be beat. But the room was almost comically tiny! Definitely the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in before. I kept tripping over the leg of the desk chair which was just a few inches from the bed. The bathroom was very small and awkward. I'm 5'3" and the space was tight, not sure how taller people even sit on the toilet! Overnight parking is $43/night which is ridiculous, even for Boston. Save your money and park in one of the buildings about a block away for $8-$9 overnight. Lucky I got a decent deal on Priceline for this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel: good location, loud hallways”
Reviews.Author: amamba
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night at the Copley Square Hotel in December. We booked a great rate online. As others have said, the location for this hotel is great and we were able to do some great shopping at the Prudential Center mall. There are tons of shops and restaurants in walking distance. The room was on the small side, but again, they are totally upfront about the room size on the website so I am not taking any points off for it on my review. The one big negative is that because the rooms are small and the walls don't seem to be that thick, I was able to hear EVERYTHING in the hallway outside my room. The headboard of the bed was located on the wall that was also the hallway wall, so I am not sure if that was part of the problem. In any case, even if you are a heavy sleeper, I would highly suggest ear plugs so you don't get waken up at 7 AM by the housekeepers in the hallway or by any other patron just walking up and down it. Rooms were clean and stylish and the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - wine tasting a nice extra”
Reviews.Author: Richard J
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly but promise to call me re a theatre booking was not fulfilled which was annoying. Wine tasting a very nice idea and well attended. Room clean and well presented although bathroom a bit small. Very comfortable bed. Would use hotel again and recommend to others who like a smaller more personal hotel

Reviews.Title: “very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Ricky47_11
Reviews.Content: stayed there on 12-3 . The staff was gracious, attentive, and professional. the room was newly remodeled , clean and one of the most comfortable beds i,ve ever slept in. it is so convenient to everything around. I can not stress enough, what a class operation this hotel is. I will make it a point to stop there again

Reviews.Title: “Cool and convenient”
Reviews.Author: bella_ferrari
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston for business when I stayed at the Copley Square Hotel two years ago (this review is really overdue! Luckily I remember everything like it was yesterday). The hotel had just finished its renovations, so I could still smell the paint - this didn't bother me at all, as from the moment I set foot in the hotel, I felt very comfortable being there. As a 22-year-old female travelling alone to the United States for the first time, it was important for me to stay somewhere that was conveniently located so I didn't have to commute much, and the hotel, fortunately, is very close to everywhere I needed to go, such as Prudential Centre and the Back Bay. A friend of mine was meeting me from New York the night I arrived, and he mentioned that the bus depot was only a couple of blocks away. I received a quiet room (I requested this as I knew I would be working a lot in my room) with a very comfortable bed - I always appreciate good quality linens when I travel. I had read that the bathrooms were on the small side, but I found it to be just right, although I'm quite small myself. The staff were very friendly, and the receptionist remembered my e-mail communications prior to my arrival. My TV didn't work the first time I turned it on, but a serviceman was at my room promptly to fix it. If I could offer a recommendation at all, it would be that the wi-fi was, although free, a bit patchy at times. However, my stay was thoroughly enjoyable, and I've already told myself that if I ever went to Boston again, I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not worth $”
Reviews.Author: gabeandmom
Reviews.Content: The staff was lovely and very cordial. Great decoration and location. The restaurant choices were good although it could benefit from a green tea choice on the menu. What I didn't like was the dark tiny room and paper thin walls. We were constantly woken up by hallway noise and our friends stayed across the street at a much nicer hotel for $85 a night less. We won't be back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gso-ceecee
Reviews.Content: Charming building with a new hip decor. Vacationed there for two nights with husband and kids, not really a family style hotel but still treated very well. Staff very helpful with recommendations. Room was small but clean and pleasant. Free wifi & coffee. Best of all location quick walking distance to all of Back Bay shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff -”
Reviews.Author: cboydell
Reviews.Content: Not a hotel with fancy lobby and reception area but the friendly and helpful staff at every turn made it a welcoming and cosy experience. There was a wine reception each late afternoon and the wine was far from ordinary - some really outstanding Napa Valley wines when we were there. We had an upgraded King after the first night we were there and the room was definitely four star plus. Spacious, very well appointed and super comfortable bed and bedding. The regular King we were in the first night was comfortable but tight. Like most big city hotels parking a pain. Here pretty much had to rely on valet parking, but they were quick and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home...”
Reviews.Author: b w
Reviews.Content: The hotel provides excellent service, comfortable and clean rooms (with such practical ammenities as flat iron, hair dryer, safe, coffee and tea for free during morning hours) and free wifi in your room. Additionally, it is perfectly located (1 min to Prudential Center, 2 min to Newbury St, 2 min subway, 10 min to Boston Public Garden).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Westtown
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Copley Square Hotel on 3 different occasions for both business and vacation trips to Boston. It is located in a great spot right by Copley Square, two blocks to the T and within walking distance to the Esplanade, the Commons, Fenway Park, a ton of restaurants of all kinds and many colleges and universities. The people have always been wonderful, though I have only had to deal with the front desk staff (not housekeeping or valet). They are always pleasant and helpful in a relaxed, yet sincere manner. On my last trip, I suddenly found that I needed to stay one more day and even though they were charging almost double what I had paid for the previous three days due to a major convention that was in town, they let me stay that extra night at my original price. The rooms are a little small, but perfectly adequate. Often it's because it is an old and oddly shaped building so the rooms are tucked in here and there--it's rather quaint. That said, the rooms are also very stylish and sophisticated without pretense. The other nice thing is that they have free wi-fi; something a lot of the "high end" hotels gouge you for at $15+/night (can you say Fairmont!?). The other nice feature they have is the 5:00pm "Wine Down" where they offer complimentary wine in their lobby/lounge for an hour, three glasses maximum per person. It's not the best wine, but it's not the worst--I would buy it for my own home as an average dinner wine. The only two things I was not pleased with or found detracted from an otherwise great place was the breakfast--both the service and the quality. The service was very slow and slightly unprofessional (maybe a new guy??) and the price for what you get is on the ridiculous side of things, especially given all the great restaurants all around the hotel. The other thing, and it's really only something I experienced from a distance and in no way impacted my stay, is the "hip" night club/lounge they have. It just seemed a bit trite and came off as trying way to hard given how relaxed and casual (but utterly professional) they are in all other aspects. Anyway, it is where I will continue to stay when I go to Boston, so even pretentious young hipsters will not keep me away!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Risma77
Reviews.Content: The staff is wonderful and really go out if their way to make sure your stay is enjoyable. It is centrally located to several attractions which makes it easy if you don't have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and very attentive”
Reviews.Author: trcekids
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st time in Boston and we loved it! Overall, our stay was very nice. I love boutique hotels and this one was perfect for my boyfriend and I (had to convince him to stay there as he's a Marriott points holder). Started off bumpy w/a tv that had lots of static and a toilet that ran continuously but when we called maintenance, they were very attentive and tried their hardest to fix everything. When their were unable to fix the problem, we were treated to a continental breakfast and upgraded to a bigger room which was awesome! It was on the same side of the bldg (looking towards the Prudential bldg) with great views of the area. The rooms were clean, bed was very comfy and the old-style feel was really cute. The front desk and bell captains were so nice and helpful throughout our 5-day stay. The hotel is centrally located; we're big walkers, so once we got our bearings, we realized how close we were to EVERYTHING. Finally, as much as I love wine we only made it to the wine reception once during our stay and for the last 2 minutes....too much to do in Boston. We'll definitely be back. To the staff....thanks for a pleasant visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: sdorrett
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect. It's near great shopping and easy access to subway. We had a premier family suite but the bathroom was very small and old. When we used the hair dryer outside of the bathroom, the power went off in the suite and had to ask the staff to reset. They have a cocktail hour in the lobby which is really nice. The free wireless is also a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location (and the bar is great too!)”
Reviews.Author: tstangel
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, incredibly nice staff, quiet rooms (even though we had a view of the city buildings), comfortable bed, and good shower. Love the wine reception, free wireless and the little touches of this hotel. The bar is good, great food and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Highly functional & a little funky”
Reviews.Author: tropicaltraveller9
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied with my recent 5 night stay. Comfortable room, excellent front-of-house staff & great location. The lobby lounge area was a great & sophisticated space for connecting with the group I was travelling with as well as with new people. Only down side was that there was no coffee maker in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Ric F
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything going for it, a great location, friendly helpful staff but potentially, depending on which room you get, a challenging experience may await ! On arrival we were told that we had been upgraded from our Deluxe Room to a corner room which is slightly bigger (all sounds good so far) The issue is that the corner room was on the second floor, above the night club & bar with pounding beats till beyond 2am, an outside smoking area with revellers screaming about till beyond 2am and a set of traffic lights on a major junction with trucks stopping at night then screaming off when the lights go green with all the resulting noise. We expressed our disappointment at check out and was given a $50 discount which helped a little but I would seriously consider if this was the experience I wanted when I return to Boston. As I say though, great location and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Chic”
Reviews.Author: J Q
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Copley Square Hotel while on Business. It was my first time there and I was VERY impressed. The hotel's personnel/staff are very attentive and friendly, the ambiance is very nice and welcoming. My room was very spacious with very nice decorations. What I loved the best was the bed, it was extremely comfortable! The location is OUTSTANDING, two blocks away from Copley Square and only blocks from Boylston and Newberry Sts with all their great store shopping and restaurants. It is also very close to the Boston Library "T" (Subway) stop. The Boston Common and the Public Garden are also within walking distance. I would definetely come back to Copley Square in my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, service varied”
Reviews.Author: FiChisholm
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is fantastic, very close to good shopping, easy walk to Boston Common, Newbury Street etc. I arrived very late at night, Front Desk clerk was friendly but no services available (eg could not get room service, no-one to assist with bag etc). I believe hotel can provide more services when they are advised of a late arrival, apparently my travel agent didn't tell them my flight time. My room was on a high floor and at the back, and was very quiet and clean. One of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. Room was very small and bathroom in particular was tiny, however totally functional. Had room service 1 night, however food was very average and I didn't repeat. Only real annoyance was when I asked the front desk for advice about visiting a particular local attraction. The person I spoke to showed little interest in assisting me, he spent the majority of the conversation typing and looking at his computer screen - I initially mistakenly thought he was looking up the information for me, however it soon became obvious that he wasn't. After telling me I could catch a train to the location, and being unable to answer any follow up questions I had, I went to the train station where I was told that there is no train that goes to this attraction and I needed to get a bus. I was pretty annoyed that this person clearly didn't know how to get there, but didn't just say "I don't know" or check with a coworker or on the internet. Definitely wasted my time that morning. On other occasions though I had really good service from the Front Desk (from different people), so it very much depended who you spoke to as to the level of service you would receive. Overall was ok, for location I would definitely highly recommend, for service and facilities I would think that similar or better could be obtained in nearby areas.

Reviews.Title: “Clean up your act”
Reviews.Author: SUVG
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend on a date night - kids were with their grandparents and we had a voucher for Abe and Louie's so figured we'd stay in town. We made the reservation via Priceline and I am so glad we did not pay full price ($300+) First impressions: The lobby needs to be cleaned. The gentleman who checked us in and the valet were both helpful and professional. Our room: Second floor with limited natural light, and small. We had a queen sized bed. It was dark when we arrived so it was nice to look up at the lights from the neighboring tall buildings. It reminded me of some mid town Manhattan hotels that we stayed in. My husband did not sleep well. The air-con kicked on at regular intervals and fair to say it wheezed. The next morning, with the lights supplemented by daylight, we saw how grimy the room was. The dust was so thick on one piece of furniture that my husband was able to write "Clean me" in the dust. When we checked out, I mentioned it to the reservations clerk. He clearly did not care. The location is great. It cost $46 to valet our car overnight. Would I stay there again? Heck, no. I'm so glad we got a cheap rate on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location. Very nice boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Wuah
Reviews.Content: I thought the Copley was a great hotel to stay at for a leisure weekend in Boston. It is very centrally located in the Back Bay district with shopping, restaurants and nightlife just steps away. I thought having a Shaw Supermarket right next door was also very convenient. The rooms were well appointed and decently sized (for a Boston hotel room), but I will add the caveat that I stay in one of the "Family Suites" - which is two rooms, that share a bathroom - so it's possible that the other room sizes may differ. Staff was super friendly and super helpful...service was top notch. I am glad to see that almost all the reviews for the hotel are very positive, but I would like to provide response to some of the negative comments or observations on some of the reviews. Some people say it is noisy, and it is true that it is on Huntington and it is sort of a "traffic" zone, but I didn't notice any excessive noise at all. I could hear the cars going by if I listened for them, but with the windows closed, it was barely noticeable. I suppose if you kept the windows open during traffic times, it might be more distracting. (for reference, I stayed on the 3rd floor on the Huntington St side). As far as room size, I thought both of our bedrooms (family suite) were very nicely sized. They might be bigger than the average room, but I thought there was plenty of room to move around and even a nice sitting area. That being said, it's not the biggest room that I have ever stayed in, but for Boston, where space is at a premium downtown, it is spacious. You have to keep in mind what the area offers otherwise. I will concur that the bathroom is a little bit small. Even for our Family Suite, I was surprised they were able to fit a sink, toilet and tub/shower in a room that small, there was barely enough room to turn around, but no points down on that for me. I'm hopefully not spending enough time in the bathroom that it should matter. The shower/tub was comfortably sized, so that was good enough for me. I guess the only gripe I had relating to the size was the lack of towel bars. There was only one towel bar which was occupied with the hand towels, that's it. It was sort of difficult to help them be ecologically friendly and hang up our towels (to indicate they didn't need to be replaced) when there was no where to hang them. And I was in a room set up that had two rooms sharing one bathroom. Would be a simple fix. Price-wise, I thought it was very reasonable for the area and the quality. It's lesser expensive than the very nearby Westin and Marriott, but very comparable (if not better) in quality. Final notes - bar and restaurant were nice. I didn't try food, but the drinks were good and layout was great. The wine hour each night was a nice touch. Free wi-fi is always nice - I'm so used to big hotels that STILL charge additional for internet. All in all, I would definitely stay here again and will recommend it to others. You can find lesser expensive places to stay in Boston - but not in this prime location or at this quality.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Customer”
Reviews.Author: Mia P
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Copley Sq twice on business. Great location, handsome rooms, very kind and helpful staff. Room service and the bars downstairs are good, and not too expensive. Nice free wine tasting in the late afternoon and coffee in the morning. They even printed a document for me and had it delivered to the room. Yay, free wifi!! Elegant without being too stuffy, fun without trying too hard to be "young" and "hip." My only complaint is minor---they seem to have some issue with their phone system. Room service almost never answers, the front desk has to chase them down. Sometimes the person who answers the phone is terse to the point of rude. I think they need an operator or someone to keep tabs on the phone. But the bellhops and desk people are very nice and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Good with some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: whataboutthecustomer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a boutique facility that is tastefully decorated and has very friendly staff. I have stayed here on a number of occasions. I like the location and it is ideally situated close to the train, shopping mall and not far from Fenway. You will need to use the valet parking unless you want to walk a block or two as the hotel does not have on sight parking. It is clean and comfortable and they certainly know how to make you feel welcome with some free services to their guests as my last visit included a glass of wine a nice welcoming touch. Here are the drawbacks. The turn down service with free water, free internet are also great services that they provide.The rooms that I stayed in are small ( I am sure their suites are bigger)... OK for one person and tight fit for 2. The bathrooms are even smaller. Rooms facing the busy road in from of the hotel that are on the lower levels are noisy (traffic noise).

Reviews.Title: “Beter Than Terrific”
Reviews.Author: CS1Dallas
Reviews.Content: Stayed for first time and only 1 night. Hotel design attractive savvy and the staff hospitable, smart and friendly. The Mini Bar is the hotel lounge and the late night snack food there was an excellent culinary experience as was the regional beers collection.Loren makes a wonderful host and bartender. Doorman outstanding going beyond in well located area. Well designed clean rooms.Would certainly recommend and return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent escape”
Reviews.Author: Katie W
Reviews.Content: This is our third visit to this wonderful Boston boutique hotel. The lobby and staff are very welcoming. The folks behind the desk were able to point us in a great direction for local food that was close and delicious. The hotel is very close to many Boston attractions and just a short T-ride from many others. The room is clean and cozy and the bed very, very comfortable. The pillows are just right (totally key attribute for me). I would definitely recommend the Copley Square to friends and family looking for a place to stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: EmilyMaine
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Copley Square Hotel four times in the past four years and have enjoyed each time. Service is wonderful- my daughter and I celebrated her 10th birthday with a night in Boston and she was treated like a little princess. Everyone said Happy Birthday, they gave her a little box of chocolates on arrival and set her up with a cupcake and candle that night at their restaurant (without my saying a word). On other occasions I have needed directions and ideas for dinner and have had pleasant interactions with helpful information. Each room I have had has been tastefully decorated, I could control the temperature, and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel is centrally located, within walking distance to many attractions and shopping. The restaurant is excellent for dinner or breakfast- many choices, cooked well, and served promptly. I wouldn't go anywhere else in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant home @ Boston”
Reviews.Author: askWulf
Reviews.Content: Really nice boutique hotel. Warm atmosphere. Cosy rooms, a bit on the small side but equipped with everything you need and stylish. Good internet connection. Many places in walking distance. Attentive staff. For me certainly a place to return to next time I visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Hillary22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely a smal boutique style old but fully renovated in a great position, thought is may be noisy from street noise but not at all, a very comfortable bed this is a must with me, I hate hard beds and this sooooo good to sleep in. Just a few train stops away from downtown Boston, but Copley area or Back Bay as it is called is much nicer in fact it is real Boston.. Very friendly staff, very helpfull with ideas on dinner ect. Would recomemend it to anyone I dont think you could get better in the area.. Price was right as well..

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Margaret W
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Copley Square Hotel for the third time, and this charming boutique continues to impress me. The service was first class - well informed concierge, and friendly housekeeping staff. The rooms are equipped with lovely sheets and towels, and the small touches (like a complimentary bottle of water placed on my bedside table during evening turn-down service) truly make this hotel unique. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Martha V
Reviews.Content: Just came home from 4 days at the Copley Square. We had a great experience! The hotel was very nice. The bathrooms are a little small but overall, the rooms were clean and the bed was fantastic. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I also used the gym and the treadmills were in great shape. The location is perfect to get around the area and walking distance from great shopping and great restaurants. Definitely worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Copley Square Hotel - very poor value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Moord13
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights for the weekend of the Regatta. Boston was expensive that weekend so we paid average of $500 dollars a night. I was expecting a luxury hotel at those prices. I was very disappointed with the hotel and was a disappointing end to our 3 week holiday in America. For a start we had a drink in the bar and there was a mouse running around the bar floor - I don't like mice as I imagine running up my leg. This may be an unreasonable phobia but for $500 a night - are you kidding me?. The waitress was aware and didn't flinch - he may of course been a pet? the food we ordered in the bar was pretty poor. The room was very small. We had 2 double beds but the double beds were very small compared to other hotels we had stayed with. The big things for me was the noise from the club which didn't stop thumping until 2 am in the morning on Friday night and then you have to wait an hour before the noise clears of people leaving. I don't understand why this hotel gets good reviews - I was so disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy refuge in Boston”
Reviews.Author: ejackman
Reviews.Content: In lieu of staying at the Convention hotels, I opted for a smaller hotel. The location was great, within a short walking distance of great restaurants, fun galleries and fantastic shopping. The lobby and bar areas offer a cozy spot to meet friends. The room was on the small size but fine for my needs. I would have liked a chair to sit in other than the desk chair but the lighting was good enough around the bed to read. The bathroom too was small with no vanity for toiletries, but the superb water pressure in the shower made up for that. I would stay there again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VLucius582
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2x with my fiancee (& dog) between September and October 2011 as I was relocating for work from Princeton, NJ up to Boston Loved the hotel during both stays. Considering the average cost of hotels in Boston proper I think this is a great value. Our 1st stay was 4 nights and we got an upgrade to a Premier King on the corner of Huntington & Exeter. On our 2nd stay we selected the Premier room and it was at a discounted rate in honor of Breast Cancer Awareness month. In the a.m. they have water bottles and towels in the lobby for those heading out for an early morning run. Every evening at 5pm they host "wine down hour" with free glasses of wine in the lobby for guests and visitors. Location was ideal for us as we took the Amtrak train into Back Bay Station. It is only a couple mins walk from the station, but intersections got rather annoying to cross. We were looking for an apartment either in the South End or Back Bay and this hotel provided easy walking distance to both. On our second trip we chose to valet park our car which was only $10 more than a garage down the street and way more convenient with all our luggage (and dog). Dinner down in the restaurant was pretty good. There is also a big Shaw's right across Exeter St. so you can stock up on drinks, food, etc. We also went to a Trader Joe's 5 mins away down Boyston St. Going out to dinner we headed towards the South End vs. Back Bay. The gym is small but has enough to get in quick run on the treadmill and some stretching. The lobby has a dark, chic decor but the rooms are very light and airy. Bathrooms are really quite nice. Everything was clean w/out smelling sterile. I would stay at Copley again if it weren't for the fact that I now live here ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, amazing staff, amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: Paula0000
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home today from a 10-day stay at the Copley Square Hotel. I cannot rate this hotel highly enough and we really enjoyed staying there. We had a nice room on the 6th floor that was decorated in dark wood and beige. The staff at the hotel were so lovely and professional and always so friendly I really was quite sad to leave! The room was cleaned every day, with clean towels and nice toiletries provided. A complimentary bottle of water was left in the room each night, along with a little 'newsletter' with suggestions of two or three things to do the following day. The hotel is about a four minute walk from the 'T' (the subway) but really Boston is so easy to walk around we hardly needed it. The area the hotel is situated in is gorgeous. Lovely old Victorian houses and shops and boutiques and many cafes. I would definitely stay in this hotel again. On the downside, I think the only things are that there was no tea or coffee making facilities in our room, or there was no complimentary breakfast. But these are minor, and I loved staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Copley Square-conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: purplehotgirl
Reviews.Content: It was a smaller Marriott, but right in the middle of everything and a block from the subway. The rooms had everything they needed, with computers in the lobby and a friendly staff. I'd stay there again! Oh, free breakfast in my package also!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chimp29
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Boston over weekend of 30th Sept 11 - spending the first couple of days with friends in Plymouth - and had booked The Copley Sq Hotel for the 2nd / 3rd Oct. Never been to Boston before (fantastic City) - and the Hotel was 1st Class. All the Staff we encountered were pleasant and friendly, the Hotel was clean and modern- lovely touch with the Wind down Wine hour nightly. Quirky lift.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poppet81
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely situated near Back Bay Station where we arrived from New York. The staff member at check-in was very welcoming. She checked us in and immediately advised us that we were welcome to come down to reception to enjoy some complimentary wine. The location of the hotel was wonderful, it was within walking distance of many attractions and restaurants. Even the Duck Tours were just 2 minutes away. The room was more than adequate, if I was to be a tad critical I would have liked a wee kettle in the room. But that is me being hyper-critical. The hotel does offer coffee and tea in the reception area. I would happily go back to this hotel, and currently looking to return for a wee holiday. Thank you for a nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Cute chic hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: lucysuze
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, right next to the Pru and Back Bay. It has a ton of charm- none of the rooms are the same shape since it's on a oddly shaped corner so that means that all of the rooms are different sized. (I asked to see a bunch of the rooms). Loved the happy hour at the hotel and the staff was really nice and helpful. Hotel was really clean and again- great location. There's the mini bar downstairs that can get kind of loud. We were on the 2nd floor right above the bar and you could definitely feel/hear the bass of the music when we were in the bathroom but if we closed the door , you couldn't hear the music anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: Jane M
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay in Boston. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We requested an early check in and our room was ready when we got there. They helped with dinner reservations and had a Wine tasting hour in the evening and coffee in the morning. The room was comfortable and well decorated. Within walking distant to the subway and the popular trolley tour stops. Overall a very pleasant stay in a great city!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: deberry10
Reviews.Content: Would have given a 5 start rating for service, decor, and location - except that the kitchen seems to have some problems. Not with food - it's great. But room service was 45 minutes past the pre-arranged breakfast time and came without milk for an order of cereal! Lobby breakfast area was also understaffed and very slow. Very convenient to public transportation and staff very helpful. Free wine in the afternoon always merits a few extra points.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: bela492005
Reviews.Content: Great little historical hotel located in the heart of Back Bay. Recently renovated while maintaining old world charm. We stayed here with our baby in September. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. The lobby is decorated in a contemporary style and felt cozy. We didn't eat at the restaurant or bar with all of the food options nearby so I can't comment on the dining in the hotel. The room was tiny which I guess is expected when you're in the heart of the city. The room was clean and the decor was obviously recently updated. The bathroom was ok, the tub was really old which I thought was odd when everything else was updated. Not the best shower either. The bed was comfy. And we didn't have any issues with noise from outside. Overall, I think this was a good option for the price we got it for using Priceline to name my price. The location is what makes this hotel really good as well as the boutique feel. The hotel is really close to shopping, restaurants, etc. We actually stayed at the Fairmont Battery Wharf for a night after our stay here and I think I would choose the Fairmont over this hotel especially since I got it for almost the same price with a special friends and family discount.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: keely s
Reviews.Content: The hotel was definitely more on the trendy boutique side which I loved. Other reviews claimed the rooms were too small which may be the case with the standard ones. We ended up upgrading when we got there to a king room and it was plenty of space for two as was the bathroom. They kept things very clean. It was also a good location for restaurants and walking to the sites of Boston. The bed was super comfy too. We were originally planning to stay at the Fairmont across the street but changed our minds due to a rumored mice issue. So glad we changed! Wine down hour was a nice touch as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and service”
Reviews.Author: Louie M
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service and enjoyed the newly renovated hotel with it's feel to history. Really enjoyed the free wine between 5-6pm. Room was decent to accommodate family with two young children. The hotel had personality and intimacy being of smaller stature to the bigger ones across the road. Also had free Internet which was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BKF59
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at the Copley Square Hotel in Boston. The hotel itself is beautiful along with the furnishings of the room and bathroom. The staff was great and very helpful about booking tours and places to see. The only complaint I have is that they need to furnish housekeeping with vacuum cleaners that can go under their furniture. We pulled the nightstand out to play cards on and the dust was a good 1/2 inch thick plus stuck on the base boards. I was scared to look under the beds as to how much dust I might find. My sister and brother-in-law were traveling with us and they found the same thing in their room two floors up. I am not blaming housekeeping, because otherwise the room was clean. Maybe a team of cleaners should go through the rooms every two months and move the furniture out so it can be vacuumed underneath.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not a Four Star hotel”
Reviews.Author: J G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed a The Copley Hotel for one night. The room was too small for two average-size adults to stay in for more than a day. The bathroom was so small we had to step into the bathtub to make enough room for the door to shut and there was no where to set toiletries. I have read other reviews comparing the room size and price to New York hotels, but let's face it, it's not New York. We have stayed in a number of hotels in the Copley Square area and found many other hotels for the same price or less, with larger rooms and significantly more amenities. Although the staff was very nice, the common areas nicely decorated and the rooms clean, we will not be returning given the other options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless service and very comfortable accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: YankeeFanatic
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend stay at the CSH with my wife and daughter for a college visits. We reserved a "Family Suite" which consisted of two separate king bedrooms of good size and a very small bathroom. The bedrooms were very nicely furnished, very comfortable beds, large flat screen televisions, individual climate controls and free wifi. For the price, this room is an extremely good value if traveling with children. Unfortunately, as stated, the bathroom is out of sync with regard to size with the two bedroom suite where more people will be using the bathroom than in a single hotel room. The service was perfect! The front desk found a room for us to check in to at 11 A.M. without giving the usual brush off and explanation about rooms not being guaranteed before 3 P.M. We parked our car on a side street having missed the proper entrance and the valet retrieved the car without complaint and parked it. Every attempt was made to remember our names, our activities and welcome us back to the hotel at the end of the day. Room service food was generally very good to excellent with prompt service...never taking more than 20 to 30 minutes at any time of day. The location was prime...with shopping and excellent restaurants within steps of the hotel. It is in a somewhat touristy area of Boston but the hotel is not overrun by tourists and always feels homey rather than institutional. I would highly recommend this hotel as a great value without sacrificing comfort, amenities or service.

Reviews.Title: “Two nights at the Copley Square”
Reviews.Author: JMRN
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at the Copley Square hotel. We stayed in Boston for 2 nights on our own prior to a business meeting I had which required me to switch to another hotel. Overall, the Copley is very nice; although a little difficult to get to if you are unfamiliar with Boston! Staff was very nice. Checkin was a breeze. The room we had was a little on the small side (think NYC-sized rooms) but the bed was extremely comfortable and the room was clean. The bathroom was very small as well; no room to put your toiletries. Our room did not have a tub; only a walk-in shower but the shower was nice. We had continental breakfast included with our room, which was pastry/fruit/juice/coffee. Good enough; prices would be a little steep if you were actually paying for breakfast. Be aware that valet parking is costly; again, think NYC prices. We did enjoy our stay and would consider a return stay if we were to return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great, immaculate hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: LMG436
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two-night stay at this hotel and cannot say enough nice things about it. Lovely decor, clean rooms, quiet hotel. The room was tastefully decorated and the right size. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. The hotel's overall decor is sophisticated but not pretentious. We stayed with our small son, and staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome and all were very nice to our child. Staff was friendly and very professional. The evening wine reception is very nice-the wine was delicious. The hotel's location was great too, within walking distance of many attractions like Newbury St. and the Boston Common, as well as a great mall and many dining choices. The "T" (subway) was right next door and within 5 minutes by T you were in Fenuel Hall. There is a grocery store (Shaw's) right next door and the Ducktour meets right outside the hotel. We will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: First time at this hotel and it was a good choice. Good location. Close to shopping, restaurants and many sites. The service was excellent. Our room was exaxtly as described on the internet. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Makes Business Trips Into Vacations”
Reviews.Author: sfexile
Reviews.Content: I want to say that my second stay in this hotel was better than the first two years ago, but that would have been impossible, as the first was so good nothing could top it. This is a dream hotel. The staff are really kind and helpful and full of good ideas about interesting things to do in the area no matter how much or little you have to spend or what your tastes are. When I explained what sorts of things I wanted to do and see and that I like to walk, they gave me amps that made it all easy. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the beds are great. The food in the hotel is quite good. I'm a somewhat fussy eater and vegetarian, but despite the proximity of terrific restaurants, I ended up eating in the hotel three times because the food was so tasty and inexpensive for what you get. The location is wonderful, you can easily walk to many fascinating places, including museums and parks. Every hour I was able to take off from the conference I attended I could spend having fun -- and I did.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great staff, great location, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Judy52
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Copley Square Hotel. Again the staff was outstanding, the room was very up to date and comfortable and you can't beat the location! The wine hour is a wonderful touch especially after a long drive!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but still old”
Reviews.Author: jumpinjoeflash
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this hotel. We had our car and let me tell you that it was not easy to locate. The young lady on the phone did the best she could but it seemed like we were going around in circles. That was really frustrating. She finally brought us up a side street and had someone meet us. The service was good, the room was OK, the elevator was small. But with other hotels in the neighborhood, I elected to stay elsewhere when i returned. You can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Always A Repeat Customer”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelerToo
Reviews.Content: Customer service is key these days and the Copley Square does not fail. The rooms are small, but always very clean and up to date. I love the wine hour in the lobby and the hotel bar, MiniBar, is lively and fun. Always meet nice people there while waiting for my friends to get ready for the evening. Have been here several times and will always go back. Key location as well.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: laura p
Reviews.Content: Thank you so much for your wonderful service and accommodations. I was in a crunch at the last minute to stay in Boston for business and Copley Square Hotel and Leigh Ann French (who helped me out tremendously) were more than I could have hoped for. I so appreciate all you offered. Thank you. Laura

Reviews.Title: “Great ammenities in the center of Boston”
Reviews.Author: Tom T
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Copley on a trip to Boston. From the attentiveness of the staff to the great food and accommodations, within walking distance to everything!

Reviews.Title: “What an absolute little gem!”
Reviews.Author: Jo M
Reviews.Content: I can not express how impressed I was with this hotel. Situated in the heart of the shopping and restaurant district, this boutique hotel is absolutely perfect. I usually stay in the big chain hotels as I travel for business a lot and I had forgotten how special smaller boutique hotels can be. Each night they had complimentary wine hour, my friend and I used this time each day to start making our plans for the night! The staff were very friendly and were always very very helpful. Wifi is free as well. If you are planning a trip to Boston seriously think of staying at this hotel. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great find -- great value!”
Reviews.Author: ravtrav
Reviews.Content: Very charming! Staff welcoming and helpful. Wine tasting each evening. Comfortable room and "civilized" lobby and bar. We chose this because it was a bargain amid more expensive big hotels in the same block and found that we had a gem. Would easily stay there again. High speed internet free as against chain hotels at similar or greater cost.

Reviews.Title: “Slept on Floor at a Four Star”
Reviews.Author: John V
Reviews.Content: I was assigned this hotel by Hotwire for a college tour trip that I was taking with my 17 yo daughter. The hotel was sweet and we were excited to be there. At checkin, we were given a queen room. I was under the impression that there would be two beds. I explained that I was traveling with my daughter and a room with two beds would be more appropriate. A two bed room was available but it would cost $50 extra. I refused to pay it because at that pricepoint, I would have directly booked a hotel closer to the BU campus. It wasn't the first time I slept on a floor, and it probably won't be the last time, but it was the first time at a 4 star hotel. With that exception, the service was great and the the employees were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “we felt like we were at a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: ladykendo
Reviews.Content: the staff here is friendly and helpful. they were really a cut above average employees of any hotel..and i've stayed in many. the decor sets a tone of understated elegance in every detail. beds are really comfortable.my back was grateful. for a nosiy city it was pretty quiet. even tho they were fully booked it did not feel crowded. the bar has nice energy. our egg white omelettes at breakfast were perfection! actually-i think this is the goal here.

Reviews.Title: “nicely decorated hotel, service is ok but very noisy location”
Reviews.Author: P T
Reviews.Content: nicely decorated hotel. Room service is slow. There's a big supermarket nextby and there were trucks loading at night time. A bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: NAM_08
Reviews.Content: We found this place somewhat by accident and initially chose it based solely on its location (proximity to where we needed to be) and price range. We simply could not have been happier with our choice and can't wait for a reason to go back! This hotel has an updated "metropolitan" style and our room was a corner room, making it extra spacious. The bedding was to-die-for comfortable and I wished we had more time to just hang around in the room. Normally, I don't want to sit around in hotel rooms, but this place was just so enjoyable. The staff was outstanding from the valets, to the bell staff, desk staff, and bar staff . (There is a martini bar in the hotel, just off the main lobby which was absolutely delightful and has a great happy hour!)

Reviews.Title: “TopNotch Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: lesorlem
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, sort of behind the library and surrounded by shops and a supermarket is across. Handy for all the best Boston can offer. The hotel is really nice and trendy - with a club, bar and restaurant on the premises. The rooms are very well decorated, albeit tiny (Boston-size). Drinks are constantly available in the lobby, coffee & tea in the morning, then iced tea during the day, and then wine in the evening (only for an hour). Another great thing about this property are its staff - a special mention to Amy at front desk and both Jose and Sam at the front door! It felt like I was coming home each time I come in or head out (do these staff every go home?!). Would highly recommend this property, and also looking forward to my next stay here! Also, check with the hotel for towncar airport transfer. The rate was pretty good. I ended up with a limo for the same price!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect urbane vibe!”
Reviews.Author: MatthewXCurry
Reviews.Content: Truly a boutique hotel at it's best! Wished we had more than a day with this well serviced (not stuffy service-actually friendly and sincere) and VERY stylish locale just behind the famous Copley Sq. library and 2 blocks away from the Greenwich Village equivalent walkable Newbury Street-loaded with restaurants and shops. Small detail note: when I came back downstairs to see if I could find my wife's lost earring, with one small mention 3-4 staff was scouring the bar and lobby within a minute! Thanks guys.....MXC Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Artgirl01
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a family funeral and it was not the best of times but it was made a lot easier by the staff at the Copley Square who were unfailingly friendly, helpful and positive. Location, cleanliness and service are all fine but the excellent staff are what makes this place. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend it highly”
Reviews.Author: momdad123
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in Back Bay Section; walking distance to shops on Newbury Street and Fenway Park. Great walk to Quincy Market, Faneuil Hall and North End. Hotel is a boutique hotel; room is small but fine for 2 adults. Beautifully decorated and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice decor and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: GWorldTour
Reviews.Content: My husband, 4month old and I booked this very lady minute and arrived late at night - we had a nice friendly welcome by check in staff and bellman offered quick food suggestions and umbrellas as it was pouring. As we had one of their last rooms we had 2 doubles but it was fine and beds were very comfortable and absolutely loved the blackout curtains (I took a photo of them as I loved the rooms decor) as it gave us a great night sleep. The only annoying thing was there was no place near the sink/mirror to put my makeup bag to get ready. Overall staff were really accommodating holding our bags the entire next day after also providing late checkout so our infant could get in a good nap. We stay in hotels all over the world frequently and service matters most to us so we were appreciative. Good location for shopping at prudential center.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Great!”
Reviews.Author: cboyden
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Copley Square this past weekend for my best friend's bachelorette party. We had six people in their family suite, which could not have been more perfect! The rooms are spacious and very modern.
