The location is so convenient to everything - with Copley/Prudential across the street, Boylston and Newbury only a few blocks away...not to mention there is a Shaw's close by! We loved going to the "Wine Down" in the lobby, such a nice touch! A few of the girls who came live in the Boston area and had not been to the hotel, but mentioned that they will definitely be referring friends and relatives to the Copley Sq. Can't wait to be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Botique Hotel in an amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: jpmarsoni
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Copley Square Hotel. The hotel is gorgeous and guest services were very pleasant and accommodating . Our room, the lobby, the corridors and restaurant are all appealing to the senses and very well decorated, not to mention impeccably clean. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary and it was our first trip to Boston. The hotel is situated in the best part of the city with access to excellent shopping and dining and beautiful parks (i.e. Boston Common). We were also a quick walk away (10 min)from Fenway Park and the Charles River. The hotel offers a 'wine down' service in the lobby at 5pm and excellent choices for red or white wine which was a nice way to socialize with other hotel guests and appreciate the scenery. Our breakfast at 'Exhale' was very nice and relaxing and we also enjoyed some drinks and people watching at MiniBar . We will definitley go back and would not stay anywhere else in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “amazing experiance”
Reviews.Author: ohaire31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Copley square hotel for a girls w/e in Boston. Upon arrival, we were greeted immediatly and told that we were just in time for "wine-down" hour, a perfect way to start our weekend. We picked up our glasses of wine and headed up to our rooms. Although other reviews had said they were small, for a city hotel, I found them to very reasonable and the bathroom was actually on the large side! Beautifully decorated, the room was comfortable and we loved the turn-down service. We used the front desk to help us with car service and directions, and always found them helpful and friendly. Overall, this was a wonderful stay and I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “First class service, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ParisRepas
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at this hotel. Because it was our anniversary, we were given a room upgrade and an early check-in, along with a card signed by all of the staff and some chocolates. The welcome could not have been warmer. Room was large, beautifully furnished, comfortable bed. All of the extras, including free wifi. We travel to Boston frequently. If prices remain reasonable, this could become one of our favorite hotels to which we would return many times.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful big rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Kate73NZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two teenage daughters recently spent four nights at the Copley Square Hotel in Boston. We travelled by Amtrak train up to Boston and were able to walk from the Back Bay station with our bags - the city was in the grip of a heatwave (about 104 that day I'm told), so it was a hot sticky walk. However the roads are flat and it took less than ten minutes to find the hotel. I understand the hotel has recently undergone an extensive renovation and they have done a beautiful job. We booked the premier family suite and had plenty of room to spread out in large, elegantly furnished rooms. It's a shame they have made the bathrooms so small - so tiny you can barely turn around in them. A really lovely touch that my husband and I took advantage of every evening was the Winedown - complimentary wine tasting in the hotel's lovely lounge. just what was needed after a hot day pounding the pavements. The hotel is ideally located for exploring the city. Duck tours start their tours almost just outside the door - a great way to get your bearings. The shops and cafes of Newbury street are just around the corner and in Copley Sqaure on the Friday afternoon there seems to be a farmers market where we bought tubs of beautiful blueberries and respberries. Without exception the staff were just lovely - very knowledgable and helpful when it came to restaurant advice - they sent us to a great resaurant in the Italian Quarter - sorry can't remember the name. Also, on recommendation of friends, went to Tico, just the far side of Copley Square - a real buzz on a Friday night - brilliant Tapas. All in all a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy & Tiny”
Reviews.Author: Camper2011_07
Reviews.Content: Did you know that Huntington Avenue is a truck route? I sure didn't...till around 4 AM, when I started hearing loud traffic noises. Couldn't fall asleep after that. Eventually I got up to take a shower. To do this, I had to swing the bathroom door closed so I could get to the tub, but I could close the door only while standing sideways because the bathroom was so small!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it...location was great, comfortable, and accommodating.”
Reviews.Author: eyedoc08
Reviews.Content: We would definitely stay here again. The king edge room was fantastic...beautiful, comfy bed, and nice size. Location was excellent. Rooms were clean and view was nice. All around great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Been before and will go again”
Reviews.Author: hrybeyr
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel....have stayed many times and will stay again. It is a great choice and value. Breakfasts are excellent. ALL staff are very helpful and friendly. GREAT location. Valet parking is a bit pricey. More reasonable parking might be found across the street at Copley Place, but would be inconvenient. Cant go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel! Would Definitely Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: daver852
Reviews.Content: The Copley Square Hotel is a wonderful old hotel in the heart of Boston. This was my first stay here. What impressed me the most was the staff. They were so friendly and helpful. I had tickets to a game at Fenway Park and arrived early, planning to leave my bags and return to check in later. But the desk clerk said they had rooms available and let me complete my check in, even though I was there several hours early. My room was very nice, and the bathroom was not small at all. After the game, my friend and I took advantage of the free wine tasting in the lobby; the wine was actually quite good. I didn't dine at the hotel, but I did have a drink at the Mini-Bar, which is just off the lobby. It's a cute little bar, although the drinks are a bit pricey ($12 for a glass of Graham Beck Cabernet). The hotel is near an MTA stop, and many atrractions are within walking distance. The next morning, there was free coffee in the lobby. I had no trouble sleeping; the night club that many people complained about is closed now. The Copley Square Hotel is a real bargain, at least by Boston standards. I honestly can't think of a single thing to complain about. If I ever return to Boston, this is where I want to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel-but very small and nosiey”
Reviews.Author: BermyChick_10
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I recently stayed here for four nights as a mini-honeymoon. I was drawn to the hotel because of its location and we had stayed in the area before. My first impression was the hotel was very modern and clean with a great bar area. The room we had, with a queen was extremely small-but had cute little add ins like late night snack menus and a booklet of stories for bedtime. The bathroom was very small-no tub, both of us couldn't be in it at the same time nor could you fit between the wall and toilet-you had to turn and shimmy over to it. The biggest let down was the noise level from the side street outside. We heard every door close, people talking, trucks reversing-loading and unloading; it was very annoying considering we were on the top floor. With this said, I wouldn't be staying here again. We have leant our lesson with hotel locations and cities. What a letdown!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SadiesPal
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small, so if you are traveling with family be prepared for cramped surroundings. The website was upfront about the size of the rooms - so I didn't penalize the hotel in my overall score - just a word of caution. Front desk personnel were very helpful as were the bellmen. The "manager" would walk around the lobby not doing much except being obtrusive and watching people. Rooms were very clean and it does appear that much of the hotel has been recently renovated. Excellent location - could walk to many attractions and there was a grocery store right up the block. Ate breakfast there twice. Decent selection and the price was reasonable for downtown Boston. The bar was nice and if the weather is nice you can sit outside on the sidewalk and enjoy your cocktail. One night, children were running up and down the hall of our floor - but it is hard to control that and that could happen anywhere. Overall, I was very pleased with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndrewW2
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic, historic hotel in the Copley Square, located close to Prudential Centre and a variety of other large hotels. I stay in Boston often and this is one of my favourite hotels in the area. The hotel is personable, practical, trendy (without being pretentious) and has a great staff that does seem to care. Special thanks to John-Paul. The furnishings are nice, new and everywhere appears clean. The gym is the size of a larger hotel room but has adequate facilities: two treadmills, two cross trainers, some standard fixed weight machines and some free weights. Not a great set-up but adequate. TV selection is very good although no international channels. Furnishings are very nice although the rooms are quite small. For example, there was very little room to set-up the ironing board in the room. Bathroom was clean, nice facilities and nice soaps, etc. Restaurant is nice and service was fast for breakfast. A nice variety of things to choose from. Overall, great stay and very nice staff. Little touches like wine tasting at 1700; ice tea during the day; coffee in the morning were really nice and make the difference. Free WIFI is fantastic and reminds you at the small value add experiences at a smaller hotel. Definitely recommend this hotel. The staff really makes the difference. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: shopaholic4220
Reviews.Content: Being an old hotel, the rooms were very small. Luckily, the bathroom and closet were both large. You don't run into a lot of the other guests. The restaurant within the hotel, XHALE, is expensive, but provides many options for breakfast. Free water and USA Today is delivered to your room every day. The wi-fi was fairly reliable, but the TV reception was not great. However, there were many channel options. The location was great. It was a short walk to Boston Common. A grocery store and mall are right next door, as well as many other restaurants and shops. Really great hotel, only downside is the small room.

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the nicest hotels in Boston”
Reviews.Author: wrightimage
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Copely Square hotel in Boston. The hotel's location is excellent, close to good restaurants and within walking distance of the waterfront. The staff were helpful and efficient. One of the nicest features was the evening wine tasting, featuring local wines and the ambience of the hotel added to this experience. Our breakfast was really great and the staff in the restaurant were very friendly. Our room was comfortable and clean and beautifully decorated. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Boston. When we left the hotel the staff gave us directions to our next stopping point, even going so far as to walk us out to the street to point out where we should go. Very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, didn't feel like a four star”
Reviews.Author: DayleePaleta
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and modern and in a great location. Although the rooms had all necessary amenities, it just didn't feel like four-star luxury to me. The vanity in the bathroom had a chip in it, and the bathroom was not very well designed so there wasn't tons of space to keep toiletries. And there was no big tub separate from the shower, which I've had at a few Fairmont's lately and is very, very nice. One of the mornings we didn't get our wake up call. Luckily we woke up anyway. The air-conditioning vent was five feet off the ground and right beside the bed. Although the room felt great when we came in from the heat, waking up in the morning and stepping out of bed into the path of the noisy air-conditioner was not very nice at all. Our room was small, but that didn't post a problem. It was very quiet, but it was a little dark. Overall, I would consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic service and we would definately come back!”
Reviews.Author: Luna14
Reviews.Content: We loved the Copley Square Hotel. It was beautifully decorated and the service was great. My husband and I will go back again the next time we are in Boston. The decor was classy and the service was friendly. We had a King room and it was the perfect size. The bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows. The location was good with only a 10 min walk to the South End, and plenty of shopping. It wasn't as close to the North End, which is where we spent most of our time, but the subway was close by and we took that. Thank you for the wonderful stay Copley.

Reviews.Title: “We have enjoyed the stay, & will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: HZT_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent, central location. We have enjoyed the courteous & professional attitude and assistance of the hotel's staff. Our room, although not extremely spacious was very convenient . The room amenities were ample and of high quality. The Wi Fi works seamlessly×¥ To conclude, we highly recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Our new hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Richelleh8
Reviews.Content: We come to Boston 3-4 times per year and will stay here from now on due to excellent customer service, clean room, location and decor. I would pay full price for this hotel! We booked through Priceline, although their website was only about $20 more. I sent the hotel an email requesting a king, higher floor room away from elevators and mentioned we were celebrating my husband's birthday. We arrived at noon and didn't expect our room to be ready but wanted to leave our bag while we were out and about. The woman checking us in was very welcoming and once I gave her my name addressed us as Mr. XXX and Mrs. XXX. She wished my husband a happy birthday and then handed him a card. She said we were being upgraded and that the room wasn't ready just yet...which we were fine with since it was so early in the day. We left our bag and went to the lobby seating area and had some lemon infused water...perfect on a hot summer day. We opened the card she had given my husband and it was a birthday card handsigned by numerous staff members. VERY nice gesture. We go away for each of our birthdays each year and this is the first hotel to give us a card. We've been upgraded before, but not had a card and upgrade. VERY nice customer service. She also asked if we needed any reservations, directions, etc. Helpful and friendly, but not intrusive. We came back later in the day and went up to our room. The hotel has seven floors and we were given a room on the 6th away from elevators as requested. The room was gorgeous, modern and clean. As others have noted, the bathroom was smaller than average, but I wasn't planning on holding a party in there, so it was more than adequate. Very large shower stall, but no tub, which is fine with me since I'm not a bath person. Vanity is freestanding with not much space on top, but has a glass shelf above and shelf underneath. The bed was glorious. Great linens and firm mattress. Some reviews have mentioned traffic noise at this hotel or others in Boston. This should be expected when one is visiting a city and there were no noises out of the ordinary. Got a great night's sleep and I'm a light sleeper. We had room service breakfast. Ordered coffee, fruit plate, and yogurt with granola/fruit. Received a callback confirming we wanted fruit plate and yogurt with fruit--not sure what the confusion was about. Food came in about 15-20 minutes as they had noted. Nice fresh fruit and a big pot of coffee with all the trimmings. Location is IDEAL for visiting the Back Bay area and the customer service can not be beat. We had a great time here and will return on our next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great, Great”
Reviews.Author: JamesTrimble
Reviews.Content: A great hotel with great service- worth all the money!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: Lirpa10412
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Copley Square with a small group of business colleagues for a "retreat". Found the lounge/lobby area to be tastefully decorated and very welcoming. It was also very clean and the contemporary style was awesome! All employees were attentive, generous and able to assist us with all of needs very efficiently. After check-in we reconvened for the nightly wine hour which is a very nice touch and hard to come by in the Boston area. We found the location to be great and were able to enjoy a lot of the surrounding area with a night cap in the hotels lounge/bar. The guest accommodations were just right for our needs, we found the rooms to be good in size and the large bed was very comfortable. I really enjoyed the turn down service as I returned to my room for the evening I found a complimentary bottle of water and the radio was on which made me feel at home! Overall for our quick Boston â€œretreatâ€� we all agreed that the Copley Square Hotel was just perfect for all of our needs. We will definitely be visiting again for both personal/business trips!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: MidAtlanticArtist
Reviews.Content: Superb location and service in this sparkling small hotel are truly unbeatable. Free wine tasting every evening a great hit. Staff exceptionally friendly, helpful, always available. Decor stylish. Only negatives were no email access (free wi-fi but we didn't bring a computer) and too-small bathroom. We will definitely stay there again. Cannot compare price as we were lucky to get reservation thru Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel with historic charm”
Reviews.Author: ESK1M0
Reviews.Content: Overall, the Copley Square Hotel was worth the stay for the price we paid. The room: We stayed in a room on the third floor. It was a small room facing Exeter Street, but it was comparable in size to what one would find in Europe. The building itself is a renovated heritage-type building and a lot of that charm still remains after renovations. The room had a contemporary design but was complimented with the vintage feel of the mouldings and trim. The bathroom: It was small and somewhat functional, likely attributed to the age of the building. While it had modern pieces, it was a bit awkward to get around. The rather large walk-in shower was a pleasant surprise, but it was behind the open door. The staff: Everyone from the maintenance staff to the doormen were quick to offer smiles and a salutation. We did not order room service, but we did talk to the staff at the main desk for directions and recommendations. Not only were the staff pleasant, but -- to us -- they seemed to want to make sure we were going to enjoy ourselves. We had to print off a ticket and while there is no "business centre" at the hotel, staff accommodated our needs by allowing us to use their computers to print things off. The location: This hotel really is centrally located! It is within walking distance to the Boston Public Library, T-station, Newbury Street, Fenway Park...! Add all these factors together and the Copley Square Hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel at central location with excellent room and service from staff”
Reviews.Author: RHiller
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Boston for the first time and stayed at this hotel from July 11 to 15. The hotel location is within walking distance of a high number of attractions. There is also access to public transit facilities within a couple of blocks. The room we had was very good. The staff members who we encountered at the hotel were courteous. They were also accommodating when we requested a later checkout time, with no fuss. The only negative point about this hotel is that very light sleepers could be bothered by the noise from the traffic if they are in some of the rooms on the lower floors facing the main street. However, everything else is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Still a good hotel but not the standard you expect”
Reviews.Author: Swissworld_traveller
Reviews.Content: Let's be fair and say that the staff is very friendly and helpful. But this hotel is overpriced and pretentious. There were patches of mould (?) in and around the bathtub as well as dark grey scratches in the bathtub. The room was very small and dark with a big brick wall facing the window. This hotel claims 4 stars but would certainly get only 3 in Europe. However the location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Central and friendly”
Reviews.Author: jan1999
Reviews.Content: We only had an overnight stay but we loved the hotel and would like to go back next time we are in Boston. The weather was hot so the refreshing afternoon drink was very welcome not to mention coffee in the morning and the free wine in an evening a great way to meet other guests in the hotel. We had a very restful nights sleep after a tiring flight from the UK, we recharged our batteries for the next days sight seeing tour . All the staff were very friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience! Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: garnevi
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly, helpful and accommodating. The hotel was clean and comfortable and in a great location. Boutique queen room was small, but comfortable for two people. Overall, an excellent experience!

Reviews.Title: “A new home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Schafeitel
Reviews.Content: Whether you are a business traveler looking for a classy hotel, a couple looking for a romantic getaway, a visiting Red Sox fan looking to catch a game at Fenway, or a family that wants to be in the middle of all the best sightseeing spots in Boston... the historical and trendy Copley Square Hotel will definitely suit your needs and be your home away from home... like we know it will be for us. My wife and I were in Boston for a few days, partly on business and also to experience everything Boston had to offer. The Copley Square Hotel is a block away from all of the shopping and dining you could imagine on Boylston Street in the Back Bay, it's right by the beautiful Boston Common (huge beautiful park) and we also even walked to Fenway from the hotel (a short and easy 15-20 minute walk). Also, the restaurant and bar at the hotel have wonderful atmospheres and excellent food. The staff is very professional and very accommodating. If you have any special requests or needs for business or pleasure, ask for the GM John. Thanks Copley Square Hotel for letting us feel like we have a home in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Very quaint and central”
Reviews.Author: mdacks
Reviews.Content: Had not visited Boston in years and was lucky to get this hotel for business at an incredible deal during a Vancouver vs. Boston hockey game. An old historic building that recently underwent refurbishment and the reusutls are amazing. The rooms are smaller but with great beds good furniture and modern bathdrooms. All around nicely appointed including the soaps and shampoos. They had a complimentary wine down hour 5-6 pm that was the icing on the cake with very gracious bar tenders. I will return with my wife to this hotel as it is very central in the back Bay area and you feel the history throughout the environs.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel. Very attentive!!”
Reviews.Author: laslist
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my daughter's wedding. The staff could not have been more attentive or helpful. I would definitely reccommend a stay here if you are visiting Boston!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: girl-friday2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on business - location is perfect for shopping/sightseeing/great restaurants. Rooms were modern and comfortable if a little snug. Also stayed in the copley plaza and would recommend the copley square hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place, perfect location!!!”
Reviews.Author: frequenttravelers68
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location to everything. The rooms are beautiful, at least the one we occupied. I have absolutely no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sailorann
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Copley in June of 2011. At first glace you won't think too much about this hotel from the main street. It's a historic hotel that has been completely remodeled. The hotel staff were great, very attentive. The ambience is very loungy, hip and modern. The room was fantastic. The layout was different, and worked very well. The room was spacious and the bathroom was very good. The room was modern and tastefully decorated. Great bed which resulted in a good nights sleep! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: ShannonJohnson
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for sight seeing! Very close to popular tourist attractions, and the subways and trains. The service was also fabulous... Not only did they help us select fabulous restaurants, but they did research and made reservations for us as well! The free wine hour was also really nice, and the bar attached called "mini bar" was super fun. Great music and atmosphere. I would definately stay there next time I am in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great bar and quite nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: BadgersFriend
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff and a great bar. I stayed in a suite which was quite nice but small bathroom for a suite. Would I stay there again? Yes, probably. I haev used the bar in the past and decided to stay there this time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: bonniebenson1404
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Check in was easy and the staff friendly Our room was clean and comfortable The bathroom was clean and spacious We loved the wine in the afternoon,in the lobby and the minibar was quaint and outdoor seating great Breakfast in the morning was great too The staff directed us to great spots and even remembered to ask how we enjoyed the Referral the next day We would definitely go back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for business mixed w/leisure”
Reviews.Author: conver2sations
Reviews.Content: Pros: - excellent service from staff - great location for walking and seeing the city - wine hour every day - modern decor and style - good wifi Cons: - downside of all boutique hotels is the relative smallness (rooms, bathrooms, elevators, etc)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ecrstraveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay. Only issues were small room (sort of goes with the territory in downtown hotels) and no coffee in the room. Staff very nice, food good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Copley Square”
Reviews.Author: littlewol
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews, I was a little concerned about noise. Ask for a room on a higher level - I was on the 6th floor and this was fine. Also, the nightclub is only open from Thursday to Sunday nights. Staff are friendly. The decor is modern and rooms are comfortably furnished. The beds and bedding seem to envelope you, resulting in a delicious sleep. Complimentary bottled water is provided in rooms and HSIA is free. There are no coffee or tea making facilities but complimentary coffee is available in the lobby. The wine down hour was also welcome be it after a day of work or play. The hotel also has gym facilities. Room service seemed quite well priced although I did not sample this. I did have breakfast in the restaurant and this was delicious, and at realistic prices. All in all, I enjoyed my stay and the location was fantastic. I will be staying here again when I return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “First time visitors - great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lpoham
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Boston at 1100 am after a red eye flight - were hoping that we could've checked in at that time, but that was not to be. Even though our room wasn't available, our luggage was stored and a restaurant around the corner was recommended; it was excellent. We were told that there was a complimentary wine tasting every evening a well (unfortunately we were too busy sight seeing to partake). Our room was ready after our lunch, and we were pleased to find a good size room with a wonderful view; very tastefully decorated, clean and comfortable. I can't comment on the lounge or nightclub, however we did have breakfast in the restaurant; it was good (our special dietary requests were accommodated). We really enjoyed the location of this hotel - restaurants, shopping, etc were within easy walking distance. We visited the markets, Little Italy, wharf and Faneuil Hall a couple of times - they were a good two hours away from the hotel, however we enjoy walking, and the weather was great. As for the room, the king size bed and bedding were very comfortable; no sore backs in the morning. We were on the 7th floor, so the traffic noises weren't too bad. The only thing that we felt was missing was a small mini-fridge in the room; it would've been nice to be able to keep a few snacks in the room (there was a Shaw grocery on the next block, which we would've like to have used more). Overall, a great stay and we would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: kermit2945
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Boston. Our family was booked in the Sheraton, but we took a chance on Priceline & got a great price @ The Copley Square Hotel. We were very impressed by the hotel, the staff and the appearance. Everything & everyone was great! And just by chance, we were able to walk about a block down to see the Stanley Cup Champions, Boston Bruins, parade & less than a block away from the departing area for the Duck Boat Tours. I highly recommend TCSH!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good staff and clean room.”
Reviews.Author: yuyo1111
Reviews.Content: I stayed this hotel for two weeks on business and in great comfort. The hotel staff are very nice and always smiling. The room I stayed was very clean, spacious and has a great bed. Every morning I could get a free coffee so I drank it before I went to work everyday. That was nice. Also housekeepers were courtesy. The location was good, near a station and you can go to a supermarket which is opened 24 hours a day and 2 minute walk away. I would like to stay this hotel again when I come back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Daily wine tasting puts this hotel at the top of my list”
Reviews.Author: jPuffDaddy
Reviews.Content: The room was great - nice bed, good shower. Staff was outstanding! Perfect location with a Trader Joe's nearby! We could walk anywhere or hop on the subway. And the wine happy hour at 5 each day just made this hotel perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, lots of character”
Reviews.Author: GracemcCarter
Reviews.Content: Usually stay in the Back Bay area when I come to Boston - great shops and restaurants. This is one of my favourite hotels here, have never had any problems with anything and love the free glass of wine you get when you come in in the evening. Rooms are a good size and comfortable, and the hotel feels trendier than others in the nearby vicinity. Usually cheaper than others in the neighbourhood and not really sure why... Super convenient location near the T, too.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we like in a hotel - one complaint.”
Reviews.Author: CEBorchers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here as the "overflow" hotel forour conference being held at the nearby Marriott. A very good choice at a renovated historic hotel. We usually don't stay at the conference hotels anyway, just to get a little separation from the intense networking. I read other reviews and made a point to tell them I am 7 mos pregnant and request a non-smoking king at a higher floor (avoid noise from street and club in hotel). They accomodated nicely putting us on the top floor. Staff was pleasant and helpful... love the Asian housekeeping staff... they kept asking me how I was feeling. Good business printing service. Had breakfast in hotel one morning - a bit pricey but good. Husband liked nightly wine tasting. Great location. Bellman suggested car service reseration at check out since we stored bags for the afternoon - great price and on time. 20mins to Logan - at peak hour. One complaint: internet was annoyingly slow. Not sure why. Would absolutely stay again if internet is fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: LeeLee3246
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay! The location was perfect to walk right out to shopping and restaurants. The staff was very friendly, and the rooms were super comfortable. Thanks Copley Square!

Reviews.Title: “Red Sox Homebase!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sherrene08
Reviews.Content: We love our Red Sox and wanted to find a hotel within walking distance that would offer great accommodations &, first class service. After testing other hotels int the area the Copley Square will not be our HOMEBASE hotel for our Red Sox!! Fun walk to Fenway on Newberry St... Absolutely modern, clean and every amenity needed in our hotel room, and the club at the end of the off the lobby was so much fun!! Thank you for offering such a wonderful experience in our favorite town, Boston MA! You ar a first class operation!!

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: Judy52
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Boston frequently and thought that on this trip we would stay somewhere different than the larger chain hotels. We had a large room with a great bathroom. The complimentary bottled water, coffee in the lobby in the morning and the wine hour were wonderful. As this was a business trip for my husband we needed the bill prepared in a certain way. We were contacted directly by the general manager who met our needs even before our stay! The customer service was excellent. The only negatives were that the air conditioning system is very loud, there was a lot of road noise and you could hear the people leaving the night club at 2:00 AM.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel with attentive staff and thoughtful details”
Reviews.Author: PurdeyHJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I first stayed at the Copley Square in September last year. We immediately liked the place - the staff are very friendly and there is always someone available to assist you. The rooms are stylishly decorated and immaculate. We also love the fact that they have the 'wine down' every evening where you can have a complimentary glass of wine from the region. The first time that we stayed we had a relatively small room, but more recently my husband has been staying there for business and we now get a very spacious room. Perhaps we have been lucky, but we've never found the rooms to be noisy. We also think it's a big plus that they provide free wireless internet. The location is great for the Back Bay Amtrak station and also for the chic Copley shopping centre. We would also highly recommend the nearby Japanese restaurant Haru. It was almost empty when we visited but the quality of the food was incredible! We will definitely come back to this hotel. It's a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “our favorite Boston hotel”
Reviews.Author: RichandCarrie
Reviews.Content: The Copley Square Hotel is by far our favorite in Boston. Understated class with exceptional service from an elite staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: kingwino1
Reviews.Content: was lured to hotel by promotion that gave you $50 credit if you presented a gas receipt for up to $50 and you parked your car over night. upon checking out I got a $43 credit and a reduction of taxes due of $7. So I received $43 not $50 advertised credit (sould be $50 credit which triggers an automatic reduction in tax, unrelated to credit). More shocking is they dont" tell you they charge $43 to park your car overnight, yes $43 for overnight parking!!!! More significant, the rooms are small and my room had a very distinct off smell that was very unpleasent. For the money it is not worth it and if you have a car you pay $43 plus tax per night just to park!

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This has to be the cleanest hotel I have stayed in. Excellent service and great attitude. The rooms are a little small but very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: burmaLincolnshire
Reviews.Content: The staff here are just fantastic, nothing is too much trouble. Ideally located, the mass transit is only a block away, the prudential mall with all its shops and food halls are across the road. More shopping and restaurants are located just behind the hotel on Newbury street and Boylston street. Yes we did here some noise in the early hours of sunday morning, but it only lasted a few minutes. Try the restaurant in the hotel (xhale) the service is good and the prices are fair ($23 for steak and rice). We will definately stay here again when in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service Esp. Valet”
Reviews.Author: sweetie387
Reviews.Content: I was in town for business and had many meetings scheduled for two days.These were back to back and I needed a reliable car service to bring me back and forth. Hineshim in Valet helped me in ordering this service and took care of all details. He was a great help and I hope to stay at this hotel again as Hineshim gave me one less worry and made my stay enjoyable.!

Reviews.Title: “Good if all you want to do is sleep”
Reviews.Author: trvlexpt
Reviews.Content: I love boutique hotels because of their details...decor, personal attention, unique bars/restaurants and have stayed in many, unfortunately the Copley Square Hotel has all the makings for a great hotel, but falls short in the actual delivery. From cleanliness (dust build up in the bathrooms), functionality (inability to print a personal document, even after they said they could) and security (a ridiculous, but dangerous fight which broke out after their club let out in the lobby, they need some managerial assistance. I do hope that they can get some, because the location, the decor and the idea behind the hotel are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great comfy central hotel”
Reviews.Author: consumermonkey
Reviews.Content: Small room but very comfortable. Service in the restaurant (at breakfast was a little slow) but throughout the rest of the hotel was friendly and helpful. The bar appears popular with a younger, non-resident crowd with dance music to match. Very close to the T and well placed for walking around Beacon Hill, Back Bay, Boston Common etc.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely trendy hotel but noisy”
Reviews.Author: demarcello
Reviews.Content: The Copley Square Hotel has a great history, location and staff. The entrance and lobby are sophisticated but dark. The front desk staff engaging and knowlegeable. The elevator is efficient but quirky as it opens to only one body width (would not fit a large suitcase). There is a central wide stairway that wraps around the elevator shaft that gives the hotel a more airy feel. Our room was a premier egde king, a pie shaped room with the apex at the door and the bed at the base> It was large, spacious and had windows along both sides. We were on the third floor, perhaps being so low and having so may windows amplified the street and nightlife noise that continued until 2 AM. Valet parking was efficient but pricey @ $43 per day. All in all a lovely but noisy stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms so small”
Reviews.Author: hafgrape
Reviews.Content: It was a busy time in Boston so hotel rooms we're scarce and we paid quite a lot for this one compared to the rest of our 3 week trip, but we don't mind that for good quality. The hotel communal areas are lovely and the staff helpful, but the room was so small, I'm 5 ft 11 and couldn't sit on the loo without my knees pressed up against the wall, nor get out of bed without kicking a desk chair. We go away a lot and have stayed in small rooms but nothing like this, the size of the room was not helped by the large furniture e.g. A big cabinet for the tv rather than having the tv on the wall, a huge desk which was useless as you couldn't sit at it - bad design. I'd like to give this hotel more points but really can't given the fundamental problems with the room. I'm sure other rooms are fine but based on our experience we wouldn't return, perhaps just pop in for a drink at the bar and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Anita60763
Reviews.Content: The Copley Square hotel in Boston is an absolute gem of a boutique hotel that is conveniently located within walking distance of many landmarks and events. The recently renovated Copley Square offers efficient services with some very quaint touches. At the end of a day of siteseeing the complimentary nightly wine down reception served in a well appointed lobby is the perfect set up to either a night on the town or a quiet dinner. This is a hotel with first class amenities and personal service without the big city attitude. Highly recommend this gem!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “Stayed in comfort and style in the heart of Boston."”
Reviews.Author: mattymoods
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at CSH it was immediately clear that this location was perfect, so much to do in the surrounding area, CSH was very convenient to shopping and restaurants. Could tell that the hotel was recently renovated in a tasteful chic way, room was not enormous but big enough, free wifi was nice. The friendly staff at CSH made us feel cared for during our stay and the personal attention we received is not common in larger hotels. Good food and drink options in the hotel, wished we could have stayed longer to use the gym.

Reviews.Title: “We were welcomed as soon as we entered the front door”
Reviews.Author: runner04182011
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 9:00 am and were immediately welcomed to the hotel. Check in is 3:00 but they said they would have a room ready in an hour so suggested an excellent place to have breakfast. We were asked if this was our first time in Boston, which it was and they suggested a tour that departed just down the street. They provided a map and had many suggestions for places to visit. Front desk was excellent for providing services. The rooms were very nice and clean. There was a bit of noise from traffic but the bed was very comfortable. There is a market across the street and shopping within a couple blocks. We enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: Shannon1004
Reviews.Content: Most of the other reviews have said pretty much all I have to say - nice hotel with helpful, friendly staff, nicely decorated (and CLEAN) rooms, and a very laid back wine tasting from 5-6pm, which is a nice touch. We were a 10-15 minute walk from Boston Common (with 2 small kids in tow, probably faster otherwise). As seems to be the case for all Boston hotels, there was a fee for parking, but the valet was fast and friendly. Our only real complaint is noise, which obviously cannot be helped by the hotel (noise was from a nearby club and its guests).

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: traceygia
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Boston with my sister-in-law, 19 year old niece and my 6 and 4 year olds. We thought the area was great. We were close to all transportation and a large mall. Beautiful hotel with great rates and friendly service. If you want kid friendly places to eat, the mall has many options. We ate breakfast at Thortons, located across the street from the mall (cheesecake factory, to be exact). Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in the Heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: TorontoBrits
Reviews.Content: Great service from the outset. Clean rooms that live up to the "Boutique" name. Evening wine tasting popular with guests. Lively bar to hang out with a martini.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, comfortable hotel with a night club problem.”
Reviews.Author: mermaidcafe
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location in Coply Square, across the street right in between the Marriot and Westin. It has a hip, small boutique hotel feel and has been beautifully rennovated. I stayed in one of the Edge rooms which outstanding windows in all directions. The only problem and it was a significant one was the noise. The first night it was simply "city" noise and very understandable if just a big magnified by the position of the room in the hotel. If you like it very quiet, be sure to ask for a room that will be quiet. The second night there was a fire alarm at 2am, pulled by someone in the night club downstairs. The third night, a Friday night, it was as if there was a party in the room and there was no getting away from it. I had memories of frat house row in college. Young people from the night club were in the street yelling and playing until well past three. I will say that the night club is not owned or managed by the hotel owners and when I complained in the morning, the staff was very empathetic. They suggested that they are trying to work on the problem and assured me that there are quieter rooms in the building to try next time. I think this place has great potential and I am likely to give the promise of a "quiet" room a chance next time I am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Adricons
Reviews.Content: The staff in this hotel are excellent, especially those working the night shift. They are a credit to the company, very helpful and great atitude. Hotel is well located with everything you could want within walking distance. Rooms are finished to a very high standard. mine had a shower only so if you wanted a bath it was not possible. Room was also on the small side but as I was travelling alone it did not bother me and it had a large desk (well lit) to work at. Free internet worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Mainematt
Reviews.Content: From the warm personal greeting to the amazingly comfortable bed, our stay could not have been better. They did a great job with the renovation and an even better job with the staff. Everyone was very warm and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value and Service in Boston”
Reviews.Author: mhyland1569
Reviews.Content: We travel to Boston frequently on business and pleasure and always stay at the Copley Square Hotel. The management team is exceptional, the staff courteous and the rooms comfortable. The best part of the rooms are the black out curtains which make sleeping easy. A nice bonus is the managers wine special from 5-6 each night.

Reviews.Title: “Staying chic in Backbay”
Reviews.Author: tdizzles
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Backbay Copley Sq Hotel is a chic habitat (without the attitude) for business and leisure travelers alike. This boutique hotel is updated and contemporary with very chic dÃ©cor and a very cool vibe. One would expect attitude here, but there is none. Upon arrival I was promptly greeted and the concierge was eager to help during my stay. I value great service and I definitely received that at Copley Sq. The location is also unbeatable, within walk distance of shopping on Newbury and in the malls, dinning, and watering holes. The only cons of the hotel are the size (and cost) of the standard queen bed room and lack of late night dining options. I had a ~210 sq ft room with a queen bed, so there wasnâ€™t much room for hanging about (but as I learned one wouldnâ€™t want to spend oneâ€™s days in a hotel room while on vacation!). The bathroom, which was very clean, was tiny with just enough room for one to take a few steps, but not more. The bed was very comfortable and clean, closely rivaling my bed at home. I found the lack of late night dining options an inconvenience; however there are late night spots located in the area given that Northeastern University is located about 10 minutes from the hotel. Pizza from BHOP was the meal de jour. The place is loud and littered with NU and Wentworth kids, so beware. Copley Sq. Hotel is also home to the popular MiniBar and Saint lounge. I spent my time at Minibar, but didnâ€™t experience Saint, which has gotten mixed reviews from the locals. Minibar is cool, but service was hit or miss. Some bartenders were attentive while others couldnâ€™t handle the volume of customers. To be sure, it was good time as I had my beautiful girl friend occupying my time. Overall, Copley Sq Hotel is an excellent option for those who want to stay in a chic hotel in the heart Backbay, but also want to avoid the corporate like atmosphere of the nearby hotels such as the Westin and Fairmont. One doesnâ€™t get much value here, but is accommodated with great service and clean rooms. I intend to make future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great surprise”
Reviews.Author: LaxnFH
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay.The staff was professional and friendly. The rooms were very comfortable. There are many nice touches...wine hour and in room offerings.Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, best location in Boston. In the heart of it all”
Reviews.Author: Sarong44
Reviews.Content: Trip advisor, always gets it right. This is the unmteenth hotel that I booked because of great trip advisor ratings. Copley square is a fantastic newly renovated boutique hotel with so much history. The hotel is classy and the staff goes out of their way for you. It is a smaller location, so no standing in lines like some of the large hotel chains. Everything about the hotel is charming. Since the hotel was built over 100 years ago, the rooms are a little smaller than your average chain hotel, but the stylish furnishings more than make up for it. I loved the down duvet and the comfy pillow top mattress. The lobby was so welcoming, great place to wind Down. The hotel has a complimentary wine down hour every night at 5 pm, and it's a very classy touch. This hotel is right on the subway line, near the historic library, and in the middle of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel......Great Location in heart of city”
Reviews.Author: bennyboy53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel during a recent trip visiting prospective colleges with our 17 year old son. Very nice boutique hotel in great location. Friendly and outgoing staff, nicely decorated spaces. Rooms a bit small, but quiet, and beds very comfortable. Rates much better than Westin or Fairmont across the street. Would definitely recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond service in a stellar location! Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Cbtennis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Copley Square during a huge snowstorm. The hotel staff was amazing. They took fantastic care of everyone, helped with logistics, kept the restaurant open all day so we didn't need to venture out. Hotel rooms were recently renovated and we pretty spacious and very comfortable. The concierge was fantastic, between rental cars, trains, and reservations (when the snow finally stopped!) they took care of it all! Love the trendy interior and the Mini Bar. Over all this is my go to hotel in Boston for business and pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay - intuitive staff!! Superb, planning a return trip!”
Reviews.Author: randomhotelinspector
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Copley Square hotel with 2 friends - we upgraded to a 2-bedroom suite. The decor and amenities are lovely...trendy and stylish. The wine reception is great - and every single member of staff we spoke to were genuine, friendly and helpful. They call themselves "intuition specialists" and it's actually spooky how inuitive they are about your needs/wants in the city. They were happy to recommend places to eat, and make us reservations, as well as give directions, call cabs and organize transport to the airport. It is a real personal service. I felt like a 'guest' rather than just a 'client' staying at the hotel. The beds were great - the bathroom like any big city was small, but sufficient, and the location is great for seeing the city. 100% would return to this hotel. No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Copley Square Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ellebeeNY
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Copley Square Hotel for 3 nights in March, and I must say it was a great experience. Like most of the reviews say, the room was fairly small, but definitely not an issue. The Copley Square hotel is in a PERFECT location, basically within walking distance to everything; as well as, two T locations for those looking to take the train (Copley Square stop and the Back Bay stop.) Another perk of the hotel was the free wine hour from 5-6pm; very enjoyable with a good selection of wine considering it is free. Do take into account that the hotel has a club and also a bar in it, which leads to some noise. However, the noise wasn't as issue for us as we enjoyed the bar in the lobby, and our room was on the 6th floor so we didn't head anything when we returned to our room. We only had 2 small issues with the hotel. First: we felt $43 per night parking was a little extreme, but I assume that is standard for any city hotel parking. Second: we ordered dessert to the room on one night, and almost $40 for 2 pieces of pie and a small coffee was disappointing considering the pie was terrible and coffee below par. Overall, we had a wonderful time in Boston and at the Copley Square Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere - and bed!”
Reviews.Author: skidzy82
Reviews.Content: I had a great evening here. The beds are super comfortable and I also appreciated the complimentary wine tasting at 5pm. The staff was really great and the valet man was very nice and helpful. Well worth the cost and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect mix of old and new”
Reviews.Author: wonder_wanderer75
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Copley Square Hotel was even better than I expected. The staff were very welcoming and accommodating as we came in off a red-eye flight - they held onto our luggage while we went out to breakfast and were able to prepare a room early for us. We loved the charm of a historic building paired with the fun, modern decor. The bar and restaurant were great too. This is an intimate, boutique hotel - an ideal location for exploring all parts of the city - I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chefkathleen
Reviews.Content: Staff was helpful and friendly; hotel was in a great location; comfortable; clean; trendy; not one complaint about this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A slice of Boston history, alive and well.”
Reviews.Author: ensoll
Reviews.Content: We greatly enjoyed our brief first time stay at the Copley Square hotel. We felt right at home the entire time and didn't really want to leave upon checkout. Thanks to the wonderful staff who took great care of us while we were there. This is an historic building which has been modernized and maintained very well. They have the oldest elevator in Boston and still use it daily, which is a neat experience just by itself. The bedding was top quality and extremely comfortable. There wasn't anything worth mentioning that we wished were different. We have every intention of returning at any opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Had the Family Suite, didn't want to leave.”
Reviews.Author: amyk2222
Reviews.Content: Terrific value in the heart of Boston, and a nice change from the "big box" hotel chains. Our rooms were very comfortable; wonderful huge bed, A+ pillows, large screen TVs, very attentive service. The added touch of free wine at 5, hot chocolate during the day and coffee in the lobby in the morning was very nice. Only negative was traffic nose, which was, on the forth floor , not huge, but would have been if we were on 2nd or 3rd floor in front. Free internet- as it should be. Loved the hotel and our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: CaptainTucker
Reviews.Content: We went to Boston for one evening to see a show and booked a room at the Copley Square Hotel. It is a lovely boutique style hotel. Our queen room was clean, cozy and had a very comfy bed. The front desk staff and valets were all courteous and welcoming. I highly recommend this hotel for a short visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay, wish it was longer.”
Reviews.Author: mswestport
Reviews.Content: Just a one night stay at the Copley Square Hotel while we visited colleges. Great location for colleges, shopping and restaurants, big and small, easy access to the "T". Serious grocery store across the street makes late night oreo and milk run a snap. Booked a room with two double beds, it was cozy for the 3 of us, but smartly appointed. Bathroom was spacious and modern. Hotel decor is well done, uncluttered chic. Hotel staff was very helpful, pleasant and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: myriem
Reviews.Content: Great location and the staff was extremely helpful. We really enjoyed our stay and I would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, walkable location!”
Reviews.Author: mbekemeyer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Copley Square Hotel for a few days this past July while vacationing in Boston during 4th of July festivities. We didn't have a car while we were there and it's definitely not necessary! This hotel is within walking distance of everything-- Fenway, the Boston Common, museums, etc. Just steps outside the door is Copley Square which had a fantastic farmer's market on Fridays. The hotel itself is trendy, but still charming-- a fantastic boutique hotel. The staff was friendly and accommodating. I highly recommend it and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “great location, newly renovated, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: katehlg
Reviews.Content: Great rate through travel zoo. We were offered an upgraded to a larger king size bedroom for 10 dollars more which worked out well. The hotel is within walking distance to the best restaurants and historic sites & shopping. It is very close to Northeastern University if anyone is looking at colleges. Staff was quite friendly and helpful. Free wine in the afternoon and coffee in the morning were nice amenities. Only complaint was the bathroom, although clean and newly renovated, it was small for 2 people but overall we really loved our stay at the Copley square hotel and would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, comfortable hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: AdrianaB84
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from a Travelzoo promotion and could not have been happier with my experience. From before I checked in until the moment I left, I felt like I was a highly valued guest. The staff was very welcoming and willing to offer help immediately. The room is slightly small, but if you don't need the space, it is perfect. I was more than happy with the quality of the room. It has everything you could need, so the space issue isn't a concern. The decor of the hotel and the room are very modern and I enjoyed how updated it looks since the exterior of the hotel is slightly misleading. It's a small detail but I appreciated that because it was Valentine's Day there was a rose left on the bed and my room was tidied up when I had left for a few hours (not sure how they knew I wasn't there but it was nice regardless!). I wish I could have tried the wine hour and breakfast from the restaurant, but I did not have time. I would definitely come back again and I would recommend this hotel to others in a heartbeat! I have worked and lived in Boston for years and never knew this gem existed but I am definitely a big fan now!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in every way!”
Reviews.Author: AnnWinchester
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. From the minute my son (17) and I entered the lobby to the moment we departed, we were treated like honored guests in someone's home. The front desk clerk (wish I could remember her name!) addressed me by name throughout our stay and offered to help us in every way possible - from holding our luggage in a secured area prior to check-in and after check-out to printing out our boarding passes and hailing us a cab. The hotel is modern and sleek in decor and immediately entices you to relax, get comfortable, and unwind. The complimentary wine in the lobby in the evenings is a lovely touch, as is the coffee in the morning and hot chocolate throughout the day. The room was wonderful, beautifully decorated and absolutely restful and comfortable. I will choose this hotel the next time I'm lucky enough to stay in Boston. It is right in Copley Square, walking distance to Newbury Street and Beacon Hill shopping and dining, the Boston Common, Prudential Center, Hynes Convention Center, the Boston Symphony, the music conservatories (New England, Boston, and Berklee), museums, Fenway and many more sites. If you don't want to walk, the T is a block away. Our breakfast in the hotel's lobby was excellent. I will definitely choose this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the thick of it.”
Reviews.Author: Satsuma932
Reviews.Content: Nestled in the historic Copley Square area of Boston, the hotel of the same moniker offers a boutique hotel experience that is more personal and less corporate in feel that weighs less heavy on your wallet than its neighbour across the street. (The Marriot). The service overall was excellent The room was great but small. Everything worked as promised. The staff was great. I only had two minor negatives. The first was that the maid service did not seem to be as detail oriented as I would have hoped. Water from the ice bucket was still there the next day. Also the hot water in the shower needed to run for a long time before it got hot. It eventually warmed up nicely but it seemed like a waste of water. In sum, the last two observations not withstanding, I would recommend this hotel to anyone doing business or doing the tourist thing in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super comfy room”
Reviews.Author: kellyk17
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel randomly for a one night Boston getaway because they had a travelzoo deal. It was wonderful. Before we arrived they called us to ask us if we had any special requests or needed before or stay. When we got there we were able to upgrade to a King room for $10 more and I'm glad we did. The bathroom was as big as my NYC bedroom. The shower was HUGE and even had a seat. The bed was super comfy and the tv was about 40' big. All create stuff for a comfy chill stay. There is a noisy bar downstairs that I was worried about since we were on the 2nd floor but we never heard a peep. They has had a free wine happy hour from 5-6 and let us take our drinks to our room. The only negative thing was the morning coffee. For a fancy place I expected better coffee, it was undrinkable. I wouldn't splurge like this often but when I do, I'll def. come back.

Reviews.Title: “OMG...waited on hand and foot...”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelersfromMA
Reviews.Content: This place is indescribable. Anything we needed, we got, in a heartbeat. We were treated like royalty. We had a wonderful weekend. The location is perfect, walked to everything. Had a blast. Wish we could have stayed forever!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy "XV Beacon" younger sibling”
Reviews.Author: SquamNewHampshire
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Copley Square. The rooms are cozy, and like XV Beacon, fashioned from former apartment rooms. The outside of the hotel is historically beautiful, and the restaurants/bars/ameneties are well thought out and fun. Our perception of value was based on our price which we received with an on-line offer. The rooms are a bit too small for any price over $200, so consider that when booking. However, in terms of vibe, service and location, it can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodHeights68
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Copley Square Hotel at 10PM the evening of an approaching snow storm; my arrival was a very pleasant experience, cleared walkways and a bellman to welcome me who carried my luggage into the hotel. I was greeted by the desk clerk who was accommodating and seemed very happy to be there on a night most people would be rather at home and under the covers. My room spacious and comfortable; the feel of old world Boston meets HGTV. The hotel amenities were good and the lighting in the bathroom was bright and sufficient. I was looking forward to a good night sleep, and I am happy to say that the bed was heavenly. Breakfast the next morning was wonderful; my server was attentive without being annoying while I worked on my laptop. The complimentary Internet was a surprise, with even the fun password which was given to me at check in. Room Service was delightful; the menu has enough variety to keep you content while satisfying any hunger. My departure although early AM, I has greeted with smiles and the offer to help hail transportation; within 5 minutes I was in a warm cab to Logan. All in all the Copley Square is the perfect hotel for business, weekend getaways or a haven to stow away from a winter storm. The charm of the building and the grand staircase make a wonderful experience for whatever your needs may be.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: napervilletraveler
Reviews.Content: Great rate through travel zoo(109).We were upgraded to a larger king room for 10 dollars extra since our double room was not ready at 11 am. This hotel is within two blocks of the best restaurants and shops/boutiques. Since Boston is easily manuevered by foot all the historic sites are within 20 minutes. Shaws and au Bon pain are great for quick bites. Staff was quite friendly and helpful. Free wifi and wine in the afternoon and coffee in the morning were nice perks. We really loved staying at the Copley square hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Great atmostphere and location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: dancingcactus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, with close proximity to anything a traveller to Boston might want including shops, great dining, and groceries. The staff was very friendly and professional. The hotel itself is very charming, and a nice change of pace from some of the larger hotels to choose from in the area. Upon check-in the front desk had no record of the upgrade I paid for through Travelocity, but still honored it. I don't know on whose end the problem was there, as my itenerary sent to my email from Travelocity showed the upgrade. The room was smaller than expected and our urban view was of a fire escape but was nicely appointed and comfortable as well as clean with the exception of needing to dust the chandelier and clean the vent in the shower. The maid and evening turndown services were VERY nice. The staff were friendly, curteous and professional and helpful in directing us to some great area restaurants. We would definitely stay at the hotel again if in the area and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Move the night club”
Reviews.Author: dapMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: Our very pleasant experience was interrupted at 2:20am by a drunken mob fighting and throwing bottles as they exited Saint( the club located in the basement of the hotel). 30 minutes and several police cars later we were able to resume our sleep. If we do stay here in the future it will not be a a Friday or Saturday night and we will request a room that does not face Exeter St.

Reviews.Title: “I'll definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: p-wow
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. Got a great deal and stayed one night for a girl's weekend. Service was unbelievable, location couldn not be beat and overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific boutique hotel with terrific service in a terrific part of town!”
Reviews.Author: MFrank_11
Reviews.Content: Discount prices can be had - find them. Wine in the evening - coffee in the morning. Whatever you need, the staff will get. I loved walking the beautiful stairs with marble flooring and beautiful carpets. We do recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: jihanalexis
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely helpful and accomodating. The apartment gives you the at home feel in a great location for business or leisure. I would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: galvisd
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights during Christmas. First of all very nice & wonderful people, always willing to help and give assistance. Hotel well located, excellent services , comfortable, nice food, quick check in / out process, good location & amenities. I liked best kindness of people.

Reviews.Title: “They just go the extra mile :-)”
Reviews.Author: Livob
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from our stay in Boston and can't recommend the hotel enough! The staff did everything possible to make our stay comfortable. Unfortunately my partner got the flu while we were there and spent a lot of time sleeping. Again the staff were excellent and even had our meal brought up from the restaurant one night when he felt sick after ordering. Luckily he didn't need a doctor, but i know that it wouldn't have been a problem getting to one if he had. The bar is really nice with very friendly and chatty staff-and there's nice food here too, as well as the restaurant. We didn't get a chance to check out the nightclub-we'll have to next time! As for the location of the hotel is great-really central and you can walk everywhere, but it's close to the T if you're feeling lazy! Finally, there's free newspapers, coffee, hot chocolate and wine......need I say more! Thanks so much for making our stay great, Olivia and Mike

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Bostonianz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for NYE and had a great time. I paid a travel zoo special of $119 for a queen rm. which I would consider a good nightly rate. Otherwise, the normal rate of $225 probably would of made my stay less enjoyable. Upside, it's a perfect location, close to everything and friendly staff. Downside, only valet parking available but for less money parked my own car at the lot across the street. Also, they didn't allow any outside food or drink which I have never seen at any hotel ever.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: bees091
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at CSH, and it was again a great stay. It is truly a great room for the price, especially for the location. I have to single out Buck for his great service. We met Buck at the wine happy hour, and his service was truly outstanding. We seemed to effortlessly provide individual service to the large number of attendees -- very attentive! At the end of the hour, he introduced himself to everyone, and he even remembered my name when he checked us out the next morning. I hope he's working the next time we stay there.

Reviews.Title: “loved the european feel of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: raynorjr
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recently updated and it looked great. Very nice clean lines throughout the hotel. Upon checking in we were greeted with a glass of wine from the wine tasting going on in the hotel. This hotel is located in a great section of Boston. Very convenient to shopping and good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel at the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked into there for three week via Expedia. Location is excellent. Shopping at Newbury and the surrounding areas. Lots of photo taking opportunities as well with all the historical buildings nearby. Get as high a level as possible as the noise from the bar and disco can be loud. Would recommend a better variety of room service dinner.

Reviews.Title: “right in the centre”
Reviews.Author: tripfi
Reviews.Content: nice smart boutique hotel right near all the shops, rooms quite small and a bit busy in terms of design. lobby had experimental scents dispersing which didn't really work for me ... but staff keen and helpful. wifi slow.

Reviews.Title: “Great as always”
Reviews.Author: sailor279
Reviews.Content: Room a bit small (Deluxe King) but they allowed us a super-early check-in from a redeye flight, which was sincerely appreciated. 2nd time here and will return. No complaints & fair prepaid price.

Reviews.Title: “Great combination of comfort, value, location, decor”
Reviews.Author: nycprepguy
Reviews.Content: Room design, quality of linens, and gym/building are all plusses. Hotel location and pricing are great. Also the wine tasting and coffee bar in the morning are great additional features. Will definitely stay here again. Minibar is fun too!!! Staff is always extremely nice and cordial and professional. I have stayed here twice and am from NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service!”
Reviews.Author: workingmom79
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively for business and pleasure; however, this is the first time I have ever received a call the day in advance welcoming me and asking if there was anything I needed for my stay the next night. When I arrived I found the same high level of customer service. My room was upgraded at no additional cost when I checked in. When I returned from dinner that evening I found the holiday music had been turned on in my room and an interesting tray of reading materials had been delivered. The hotel was very clean, the bed extremely comfortable and the customer service was superior. I have never written a review before but this experience certainly warranted one.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: RobinWyman75
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews are accurate. Rooms are still a little run down. We were on the 3rd floor. The windows are very thin. Had to turn on the heat till 74 to get warm there is a large draft from the window. The noise from the street is unbelievably loud! We did get an upgrade when checking in. Hate to see what we would have originally gotten without the upgrade. Also, didn't get the safest feeling overall. If you get on priceline great! But for the price stay at the Marriott or the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: marcottejim
Reviews.Content: My wife found this place by winning a bid on priceline. It was far fancier than any hotels we normally stay in - but it was great! We really liked the decor, including the chandelier in the bedroom. The staff was very nice. Check-in, check-out and the valet were all very quick. We had breakfast on Sunday morning in the hotel's restaurant, and it was delicious. I would definitely recommend this place if you're going to be in the Copley Square area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lisa23Uk
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and prompt check in and we were given a room on the top (36th) floor which had a great city and harbour view . The hallways leading to the rooms are stark and lack any furniture and flowers etc but the rooms are well decorated with very comfortable beds and crisp white linens. Bathroom is a little small but perfectly adequate. I ordered a meal in the room on arrival which was very good, in fact room service was excellent as our needs were met promptly. The hotel is perfectly located for Newbury Street, the T and the trolley bus and you can walk from the hotel via a tunnel directly to the shopping mall. I loved Boston and can't wait to visit again and would definitely choose to stay at Copley Square . Only negative: the wi-fi charge.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel on the step to what boston has on offer”
Reviews.Author: MunsterLimerick
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the copley square in march 2010 and we thoroughly enjoyed it. our stay was for 1week and the purpose of the trip was to celebrate paddies day in the states. starting from the top the hotel staff were extremely helpful and very courteous. the room we had was so lovely real chocolate feel. it was spotlessly clean and the rooms were serviced everyday with fresh towels and toiletries.we had no problem with noise while trying to sleep when staying there. i imagine if there was noise it would only be traffic remember your in the heart of the city. the hotel had a wine hour approx 6pm every evening where you can mingle with other guests in the hotel its a really lovely gesture. the hotel was located beside the prudential centre and the marriott hotel is across the road and has a huge shopping mall also with all the designer brands such as coach, fendi and jimmy choo for all your shopping needs and the underground was like 2mins away and took you where ever you wanted to go. all in all had an amazing time at the copley square and will return in our next visit hopefull next march 2011.

Reviews.Title: “If you like the smell of musty mildew this is your place”
Reviews.Author: madlyw
Reviews.Content: With a recent multi million dollar renovation, the copley square hotel, missed an important mark. The old musty smell of the place was never alleviated. When the front desk was notified of this problem, a staff member zipped up to our room with an air purifier, leading us to believe that we were not the only patrons in the hotel with this problem. Luckily we were out and about. Great location, great bar ( $2.00 Kobe sliders on Mon-Thurs), good valet service. But the smell.

Reviews.Title: “The Copley suite was very nice, an oasis in busy Boston”
Reviews.Author: Jackban
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 2 room suite and were very pleased with the rooms. The living room area was very comfortable and the drapes and shears offered a toned down feeling that was very peaceful. I very much enjoyed sitting on the couch reading while just barely listening to the city below

Reviews.Title: “Copley Square Hotel always a good stay!”
Reviews.Author: HHuisman
Reviews.Content: Once again I found myself in the Copley Square hotel. And yet again my stay was perfect! The hotel is modern, the staff is very friendly and helpful, the location is perfect and the Mini-Bar is a great bar. Some of the rooms are a bit small, so you wouldn't want to spend your days inside the room. Luckily Boston is a great city with lots of things to do. Would definitely recommend staying in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I was very impressed - wish all hotels were like this”
Reviews.Author: iPablo14
Reviews.Content: This an awesome hotel and has a certain uniqueness factor that the other big chain hotels in the are simply cannot replicate. It was modern and trendy, the staff was courteous and very accomodating, and the entire place was exteremely clean. Again - I can't stress it enough - if you need to be in this area, forego the big hotels across the street or around the corner and stay here instead.
