I was in this area for the entire month of August on business (mon - fri) and instinctively stayed at the Mariott the first time. The second week I was able to get a cheaper rate here, so I decided to give it a try. The experience blew me away and stayed for the rest of my trips here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel .... nothing to complain about”
Reviews.Author: mandbd
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a great location albeit not in the centre but Boston is a compact city and easy to get about though beware the traffic can be bad at times. Adjacent to Trinity Sq, shopping malls with plenty of restaurants and shops. The room was very clean and tidy the bar always busy. Free coffee in the morning was nice as was the wine tasting in the afternoon. The bathrooms are small but we didnt have to stand on the toilet to use the shower as others have suggested. Staff were friendly. For us a problem might have come from arriving at 11am from an overnight flight to be told that our room wouldn't be ready until 3pm. This was not mentioned in the confirmation but the hotel immediately facilitated a room when explained without any issue. Would stay there again. Read that a club attached to it led to noisy nights but we never had any experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super cute and trendy for a great price”
Reviews.Author: carlaht
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Boston for Labor Day and we stayed at the Copley Square. We loved it! The hotel is cozy, cute and the best about it is the location. We could walk to Newburry Street, Boston Commons and cabs were cheap enough to go to the North End and Fenway. The rooms are clean, trendy, small but really up to date. They offered a free wine hour from 5-6 pm daily ( we totally loved that), the room service food wa great and the service top notch. Definately suggest to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a Few Problems”
Reviews.Author: Nannel
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in the family suite. This was a great suite to stay in when traveling with 2 teenagers - everyone had space to spread out. For the most part it was a great hotel experience. We enjoyed the wine at 5 pm every day. We had two negative parts of our experience. The first was that while we were out all day long touring, our room never got cleaned. We left the room at 10 am and returned at 4 pm and the room was never made up or cleaned. It took another hour to get someone to clean our room after calling the front desk. Secondly, someone signed us up for a 5 am wake up call (not us) and we received calls at 5 and 5:15 am. We had gotten to bed late the night before and did not have to be out of the room until 10 am that morning so this was very irritating. When I called the front desk to ask them to stop calling us, I was told that we had put in for the wake up call. We had not!!!! Great hotel and we would stay there again but just a few service issues.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Travelnut40
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for one night in August. The hotel is centrally located near plenty of restaurants, bars, shops and the Prudential Center. The valet parking cost was $43 a night, but that is the average cost in Boston when you valet overnight at a hotel. We walked to Fenway Park for a Red Sox game from the hotel which was about a mile and a half away. The hotel itself is very urban and sheek. The young lady at the front desk who checked us in was very nice. We reserved a Petite Queen room. The room was sufficient for a one night stay, but the bathroom was sooooo small. It was comical watching my husband trying to navigate in such close quarters. But we expected that because of the prior reviews. The decor in the room was very nice and modern and all of the amenities were great. We enjoyed the complimentary wine tasting the lobby at 5:00pm and we also enjoyed the coffee in the morning. The hotel bar called â€œmini barâ€� was packed in the evening and we enjoyed the music and drinks there. We did not eat at the hotel due to the limited time spent there and many dining choices in the area that were available. I would definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “What more could you want from a Boston Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: aisling-and-james
Reviews.Content: Really had a great stay for 4 nights at the Copley Square. The staff were wonderful and helpful. The free wine from 5-6pm was a very nice touch. The rooms were small but perfectly formed and the "green" touches were subtle but a bonus (cornstarch shower cap instead of plastic). The staff were always cheerful and helpful, there was always coffee on the go too. The location was great, really close to the Duck tour starting point, beside the Copley mall, about 5 minutes walk to the nearest T station and only about 10 minutes walk to the shops on Boylston and Newbury Streets. We returned to Boston for a few more days at the end of our trip and I really wish we had booked back in there (when I was booking I thought it would be fun to stay somewhere different, I was wrong!).

Reviews.Title: “Suites are ideal for families with young children- lots of room & quiet!”
Reviews.Author: BeckyinClevelandHts
Reviews.Content: I usually do not send in reviews of hotels, etc. but was just so pleased with this place I had to write one for the Copley Square Hotel. We were actually there so that my husband could attend a conference at the Marriott across the street but I also went with our two small children (3 yrs old and a 10 month old). I usually opt out of tagging along on business trips because being stuck in one hotel room with two small children is not my idea of fun. This suite was phenomenal- you enter the suite by walking into a small hallway and off the hallway there is a small but very new and clean bathroom. The two bedrooms are also off this small hallway. Both rooms contain king beds with desks, chairs and a cozy modern couch. One room also has a closet in it big enough to fit a pack n' play- therefore we were able to put our son in one bedroom and our baby in the closet and enjoy some alone time in the bedroom. The bedrooms are both very large and we found them to be very, very quiet. There is some street noise (expected in Boston!) but being on the fourth floor - which is not very high- it was not that bad. I heard nearly no hallway noise or noise from other hotel guestrooms. The beds were very comfortable and everything is very clean and obviously fairly new (apparently they renovated the entire place about 1.5 yrs ago). The staff was very, very helpful and polite. We ate breakfast at their restaurant and also ordered room service one night- all our food experiences and service experiences were great. I was concerned that we would feel uncomfortable or not as welcome since it is obviously a fairly hip place to hang out in the evenings (they have a nice bar area)- but this was definitely not the case at all. The location was excellent- a very easy and close walk to the Copley T stop as well as an easy walk to the public gardens, public library and tons of shopping and restaurants. Oh, and a Shaws grocery store is literally next door in the Prudencial building. We were able to buy some things for breakfast and lunch and keep them in our refrigerator (which I requested). Last thing- of course this suite was pricey BUT they currently are offering a special which involves you paying the full amount ahead of time (no cancellation policy) and you save hundreds of dollars as a result. This is what we did and it was cheaper than a much smaller suite at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel ...and Boston”
Reviews.Author: Esther1
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay - the rooms are not that small compared to European standards and ours was very comfortable - I had a really good nights sleep which is sometimes hard to do in a strange bed. The wine down is a nice touch, after a hard days sightseeing - and you don't just get one teensy glass of wine - every time my glass was empty it was instantly refilled - and given the price of wine in Boston, this was very much appreciated. The rooms and public areas were clean and the hotel is in a great location. I was quite sorry to leave it and Boston, which has been one of the best US cities that we've visited and was the highlight of our New England tour.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but didn't live up to reviews, nor boutique title.”
Reviews.Author: Simondo78
Reviews.Content: I visted the Copley Square Hotel as a business client. Having reviewed several hotels on TripAdvisor in great detail, I decided that the Copley Square must surely be a dead-cert for a quality, comfortable and rememberable place to stay; suffice to say I was very disappointed from the start of my stay. I payed over Â£1700 for a six night visit, staying in what was described as a boutique-queen room with wine reception. My boutique-queen room didn't live up to the title. I was on the top floor with a view that looked across to another high-rise building just several feet from my window. My room was small but well decorated. It was disappointing to find that there was no fridge, dust around the skirting and lampshades, bed sheets that had small stains on them and a very small bathroom that could be described as 'fairly' clean. Generally, the Hotel Copley is a 'nice' place to stay, if one has payed up to Â£150 per night for the room. Unfortunately, the Copley Square Hotel oversell's itself from the ad's/reviews I have observed and needs to seriously 'up it's game' in both service and quality if it wishes to continue to appeal to it's respected market. My stay was comfortable but knowing that the Copley had spent many millions on reinventing itself, I was very disappointed. My stay was comfortable but I'd advise the Copley that they are not playing in the hotel league that they think they are.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to Improve”
Reviews.Author: travel5612
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is wonderful - Back Bay near shopping, restaurants and sights. We traveled to Boston and had requested a large double room with a roll away. The room was small. The roll away bed was old and the mattress was soft. It had one very tiny closet. The noise outside of our window at night was unacceptable. The next day the management upgraded us into a two bedroom suite which had soundproof windows and two wonderful large king beds. Very nice. The daytime staff was wonderful. The evening staff seemed uniformed and not very helpful or friendly. Wine in the evening at 5 pm was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Service and staff as good as I've experienced.”
Reviews.Author: jglennCapeGirardeau
Reviews.Content: Someone recommeded my 2 sons and I stay here on a quick trip to Boston. We were very pleased with the location, close to tons of shopping and to Fenway Park. The staff treated us like we were family. Found my new Boston hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: clairemc10
Reviews.Content: This was a hotel recommended to us, but it has always been too expensive for us to justify staying here. Thought this vacation we would give it a go. I'm glad we did, although I still think its a little expensive for what it is. Our last vacation we stayed at a nearby hotel, for a substantial amount less per night and that hotel was better than Copley. I haven't really got any complaints about Copley, its in a great location, very smart looking and great staff. The room itself was a little small, reminded me of a typical hotel room in New York, however was quiet, clean and had a great nights sleep every night. I'd recommend this hotel and would consider it again, however the price in comparison to other hotels would be the deciding factor in whether we chose here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best location, amazing service, and amazing staff.”
Reviews.Author: IcedOrange
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the best location ever. Whether you are looking to go clubbing (right downstairs), shopping (two blocks from Newbury St.), touristing (right next to the Duck Tours), or need to get to another part of Boston (its on top of the T stop), you have immediate access. The building is a recently renovated historic building, so you have the best of both worlds - old-school architecture with all the latest amenities. Finally, the staff is amazing and will help you with anything you need. We were one of those "large families with small children on vacation" and they helped us with everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was great!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFliers30306
Reviews.Content: The bedrooms were spacious and nicely decorated. The bathroom was tiny but serviceable and clean. The restaurant breakfasts were delicious and not over-priced. Room service was quick and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Stay”
Reviews.Author: leolbster
Reviews.Content: My finacee and I traveled to Boston with some friends and stayed three nights at the hotel. We loved it! The location was perfect and the staff were very helpful. The only criticism I would have is the size of the rooms. They were very small. That said, if you're only planning on sleeping there and spending the days out and about, this place is PERFECT. They have a great little Martini bar at the hotel that is always jumping and a nice restuarant as well. It was quiet, elegant and worth the price, which was modest by my standards!

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get much better than this!”
Reviews.Author: Lockheed1997
Reviews.Content: The only critique from my 7-year-old was that we only stayed here one night! The room was clean, comfortable, and functional for the four of us. The bathroom was impeccably clean. Great location for accessing downtown, whether by foot or subway (we did both). The supermarket around the corner was a plus as well. I can't say enough good things about the staff. They truly enjoy what they do, and it shows. After visiting the Copley Square Hotel, my family now knows what true hospitality is all about. We can't wait to come back. Wholeheartedly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “excellent blend of modern style in an old hotel”
Reviews.Author: aidanamurphy
Reviews.Content: my wife and I stayed here as the end of our honeymoon and I honestly cant recomend it enough. The staff are excellent, very friendly, helpful and very knowledgeable. The hotel itself is among the oldest in the City and has recently been renovated and redecorated, and John and his team really have managed to do a fantastic job. The old style layout is still very much intact, yet the blend of modern decor and features have been achevied brilliantly. Localation wise also you will do well to find a better place to stay.I will most definitely return to this hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great People!”
Reviews.Author: csimonetta
Reviews.Content: I must say, this hotel is conveniently located around the corner from Copley Square, a block from the subway, two blocks from Newbury St. I mean you couldn't have put it in a better place in the Back Bay if you tried! Oh yeah, there is a 24 hr grocery store a block away for those late night needs, and if you are in Boston for the sight seeing, the Duck Tours are a block away as well. Truly a center cell. The beds were very comfortable and the room was just right for a solo traveler. I stayed 3 nights in a standard King end unit, and couldn't have been happier. Wine tasting from 5-6 in lobby nightly, and even attracted a sophisticated late night crowd in their inside/streetside lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel, great location, some...”
Reviews.Author: auggirl
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel, great location, some small issues with tv, sheets, and tp roll holder...but we did get to check in early on a very hot day, and leave our things at the hotel the day we departed, for pick up later... Staff very nice and professional. A Shaws Supermarket one block away, Newbury St two blocks, really a good overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled Boston location, comfortable, and not a chain”
Reviews.Author: MonkeybearNYC
Reviews.Content: The Copley Square Hotel is a lovely medium-sized hotel in an unparalleled location (and you are paying in part for the location--itâ€™s not inexpensive). Itâ€™s comfortable, bordering on luxurious; I stayed in the smallest room, which wasnâ€™t actually all that small, and which -- although it was supposed to have an â€œinteriorâ€� view -- in fact looked out over the street. Friendly service, appealing lobby and hallways, flat-screen TV with better-than-usual selection of cable channels, nice bath (no tub in my room, which was fine), and free wi-fi throughout. From here, you can walk up and down Newbury Street and get the subway anywhere. Itâ€™s a nice place to come home to after a full day of work (or play).

Reviews.Title: “Great Service! Loved the wine tasting hour!”
Reviews.Author: rmg1115
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Copley Square Hotel were terrific! They always greeted us and were super friendly. The beds were ridiculously comfortable and the room, though oddly shaped, was very nice. The bathroom was large and awfully spacious (for a hotel bathroom). I had a bottle of wine with me but forgot a wine opener. We called down to the front desk to ask for a wine opener. The guy who came up (in just a few minutes!) opened the bottle for us and even gave us a wine opener to keep. He was even non-plussed at the sight of my very gay, bare chested friend lying on the bed. They had complimentary coffee in the morning and a free wine tasting hour in the evening. It is pricey, though. If you can get a deal like we did, definitely stay here! Great staff! Great time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ptrounstine
Reviews.Content: This is a fine little hotel in a terrific location. We stayed three nights in July 2010. The room was a bit small, the TV reception was lousy and the bathroom was cramped (also, the toilet paper holder was busted). But the room was very comfortable, the bed and linens were excellent, everything was clean and the staff was terrific. The hotel offers room service for breakfast and dinner only, but when we wanted a club sandwich for lunch, the staff got one for us. Also, when we had an emergency after leaving -- we had left our passports in the room safe and were headed for Canada -- the staff got them and helped us get them by FedEx the next day. It's a great place to stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Coming Back...”
Reviews.Author: cboyden
Reviews.Content: The Copley Square Hotel is our "go to" hotel every time we visit Boston. As a MA native, I know there are tons of options for staying in the city, but the Copley Square is second to none. The very-well trained staff are extremely attentive from the moment you walk in the door. Easy check-in process and very trendy space...The rooms are very modern but keep the old school charm of the hotel before the renovations. The "wine down" in the lobby is a great bonus and the entire hotel has free wi-fi! Minibar on the lobby level is a great pre-dinner place for drinks in an awesome setting. Being a New Yorker now, it's hard to find a bar that compares to all of the trendy spots in Manhattan, but the Copley Square has it down! The valet here also has it down - we needed a taxi and he actually sprinted down the street to another hotel to get a taxi for us in a hurry -- talk about customer service!! We will be back to the Copley Square Hotel soon...our only choice for accommodations in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: glasgowglobetrotter8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this Hotel for four nights at the start of July. We had booked a standard Botique queen but paid an extra $10 per night for an upgrade. The room was very small but cosy. Our room was located to the front of the Hotel and we found it to be quite noisey with passing traffick during the night. The decor was very modern and the housekeeping service seemed on the ball.Breakfast in the Hotel was good but a bit pricey.The location was great, within walking distance of most attractions. Mini bar was quiet but could have had better opening times.We had a bad experience with one member of staff in the mini bar. My pregnant wife was told to finish a bottle of water she had with her or bin it, even though we were still ordering other drinks in the bar.This could have been handled better , and the particular member of staff seemed to have an attitude problem.Overall front house staff were helpful, overall our stay was good but not great.

Reviews.Title: “COPLEY SQUARE HOTEL-A MUST STAY!”
Reviews.Author: DGTrav
Reviews.Content: I usually don.t write reviews on hotels. But I feel I must on this hotel. They did a great job on the renovation! My room was spacious the bed was extremely comfortable, I would like the name of the mattress. The bathroom lighting was great for makeup application. I enjoyed the restaurant, great service and food. The staff, what can I say, from the doorman to management, they were extremely helpful. I look forward to my next trip to Boston and the Copley Square Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, in the heart of downtown”
Reviews.Author: TravelerDG
Reviews.Content: OK, so the room was teeny-weeny - we had a boutique queen room for 1 night, not much bigger than our bedroom at home for $143 w/AAA rate. Great for 1 night, but would have felt really cramped and constricted for more than another night or so. Very comfy bed w/4 pillows and a down comforter. Hallways to get to the rooms were curved and the elevator was really small too, but it kind of added to the charm of the place. Our bathroom was wallpapered with excerpts from "Paul Revere's Ride". Staff was also very helpful. In the heart of downtown, close to the mall and library and not too far from a T-stop. Had trouble getting to the front of the building for valet due to Boston's confusing streets! Missed it the first time, and it took over 20 minutes to navigate back there!

Reviews.Title: “The Copley Square was elegant with a historical touch.”
Reviews.Author: Gina1321
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent choice for us. The historical decoration with a modern feel was done with excellent taste. The room was very cozy and clean. Service was top-notch and equal from top management all the way down to the front line employees.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated & beautiful hotel in great downtown location, friendly staff always available to assist you.”
Reviews.Author: firebirdtaz
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel with a great location and all the amenities, this is it. Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The restaurant had great food and service, and the nightclub was the place to be. They also have a fitness center where you can work out if that's something you're looking for. It looked great from my standpoint (looking in, not going in)! Considering you're downtown Boston, the price of the room was as accomodating as was the great staff that greats you. I was very happy with our stay at the Copley Square Hotel and you will be too.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: MAS06
Reviews.Content: The Copley Square Hotel is in a great location,walking distance from Back Bay train station which is how we got into Boston from New York. It is also close to Newbury st where there are great restaurants and has excellent shopping. There was other shopping centres nearby also. The staff were very friendly and every afternoon between 5pm & 6pm you can have a complimentary wine. They have different brands every day. We tried the hotel restaurant and had a really nice open hamburger.The room was very clean,the bed was very comfortable and had a bath which was great after walking all over Boston. All in all a great hotel to stay. Also a great place to visit is Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum which has a fantastic courtyard .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: LAnders8547
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Copley Square during the fourth of July. PERFECT location and extremely thoughtful and professional staff. We walked ALL over the City and to come back to relax in our lovely room made our stay a pleasure! Thank you !

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: RGH8800
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Centrally located in the middle of everything Boston has to offer in the part of town called the Backbay. This hotel is within walking distance to Fenhuil Hall, the Boston Commons, Prudential Shopping area, Northend and Boylston St shops and restaurants. I gave this hotel a 5 star not only for its location, but also for the service and the amenities they offered. I think this might be my favorite hotel in the Copley Square!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Cozy, & Chic! My favorite Boston Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chrissybo
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic! Restaurants,Museums, Newbury St Shopping all in walking distance. The Lobby is Stylish and Comfy, Wine tasting at 5pm is complimentary and fun! The staff is excellent...so friendly and full of ideas for things to do in the city...just ask. The rooms give you an old world feel with a modern day flair. Loved this hotel and will definetly go back!

Reviews.Title: “BEST BED EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cattycat99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for college graduation in May with extended family. EVERYONE commented on how great the beds were -- definitely the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. If anyone knows what beds they use -- please email me! The other two highlights were the service (absolutely top-notch) and the location (short walk to Newbury Street and Prudential Center).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, overall great experience”
Reviews.Author: mbanks58
Reviews.Content: I travel to Boston a fair amount for work and just completed my 6th stay at the Copley. This hotel is in an excellent location and provides the personal commitment to customer service that is becoming harder to find in the hospitality business. Every time I check in the staff welcomes me and thanks me for returning. They do there best to give me the best accomodations available. This is the only hotel I will stay at in Boston and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a place to stay for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “top notch”
Reviews.Author: redjimmy
Reviews.Content: my wife and i loved this hotel.we were staying in boston for the 4th time and booked this hotel through alpha rooms and got a brilliant deal,but hey i would have paid more for this exceptional place.the staff were all very friendly even the maintenance guys,from front desk to dining room staff they all greet you with a smile and hello.as this was our 25th wedding anniversary we e.mailed the manager john and asked for a nice room and we were not dissapointed we got an upgrade to a king room with complimentary water, the most comfortable beds excellent room service and everything sparkling new,yes this hotel had a 20 million upgrade but the service is second to none, if in boston stay here at the copley,you will not regret it.on the plus you are close to everything you need,a shaws supermarket, the T just a block away, newbury street,boston common a lovely walk and duck tours right outside hotel. thanks the copley square hotel for making our stay a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to its billing”
Reviews.Author: luxuryhoteljunkie
Reviews.Content: I had a choice between the Copley Square Hotel and the Fairmont Copley Plaza Hotel. I was looking for a hotel with a very deluxe feel and the Copley Square Hotel, which bills itself as a deluxe boutique hotel, seemed to fill the bill. Because I was traveling with another colleague who had a reservation at the Fairmont Copley Plaza Hotel, I was able to compare rooms. Both hotel rooms cost approximately the same. However, my colleague did get at upgrade at the Fairmont so keep that in mind. My room at the Copley Square Hotel was a deluxe premium king so it was a very good room, only surpassed I believe by suites and corner deluxe premium kings. The room was newly decorated since the hotel has had a recent refurbishing. The colors were a little dark -- muted browns and greys. It was fairly spacious but not nearly as large as my colleague's room at the Fairmont, which was almost double the size. In addition, the bathroom was tiny -- so small that if you stood in it, you could only turn around -- you couldn't take one step in it. When I first got there, I was stymied by the lights in the bathroom. I couldn't figure out where they were. I even felt along the walls thinking they might blend into the wallpaper. I finally found them hidden under the towels. Incidentally, my partner, who checked in after me, had the exact same experience and had to call down to the front desk for help. So it wasn't just me. This bathroom, done in very conventional tile, was particularly annoying compared to the Fairmont's which was in marble and nearly 3 times bigger. Noise was a problem in this hotel. The hotel prides itself on being chic and trendy and has a bar to go with it. The problem is that when the bar closes at 2 am, the crowd gathers outside on the street and keeps you up. The soundprroofing in the windows seems non-existent. The hotel cannot both have its cake and eat it. It is clearly profiting greatly from its lively bar scene but this does cause a noise problem which it hasn't dealt with. Room service was not existent during the day and only started at 5 pm, aside from breakfast. My meetings actually allowed me some in room time in the middle of the day. I would have liked room service so I could work without having to go out to a restaurant. This was very annoying. In addition, room service closed at 11 pm. In a hotel that places itself in the deluxe category, not having room service in the middle of the day is almost unheard of. Finally, some of the front desk people were clearly more used to serving as chic and trendy ornaments than well-trained in taking care of clients' needs. Next time I visit Boston, I'm going to stay at the brand-new Mandarin Oriental down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Boston MArathon”
Reviews.Author: Zymurgyst
Reviews.Content: Stayed with the family for the Boston Marathon. The location to the finish is awesome. The staff was prepared for race participants. I had a single room with a pull out. The king size bed was great, but the pull out not so much. I would stay again, but make a better room selection for the family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: I-love-love-holidays
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay in the Copely Square Hotel in Boston. Got a great deal on easyclicktravel which swyaed us to make the booking. When we arrived we were offered a room upgrade for $10 a night so of course took that! The room was spacious, newly decorated, very clean, good storage for luggage so werent tripping over it in the room and the beads were extremely comfortable. The hotel has free wi-fi and the room had an ipod station which was very handy. The hotel location is brilliant. We were within walking distance to the pubs and restaurants and a quick tube ride from Faniual Hall and Quincey Market. I would definatley stay in this hotel again if I am lucky enough to go back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jpateAL
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location. Walking distance to shopping/restaurants. Easy access to the T and Tour stops. Rooms were nice. Beds were very comfortable. Not sure if it was the Sam Adams but I slept great every night. Bathrooms a little small and no mini-bar in rooms, but the "Mini-Bar" lounge downstairs was open late for nightcaps.

Reviews.Title: “Completely recommend this comfortable hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: sammysm
Reviews.Content: My room had plenty of room. The bedroom was well appointed and quiet and I had no problem with the size of the bathroom. The location is perfect and Copley Square has become my new fav in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Fully enjoyed our stay....”
Reviews.Author: VoorheesFam
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Boston with my husband and two teenage children. The hotel was contemporary and impressive. We were greeted by two wonderful staff who checked us in earlier than expected and booked a tour of the city for us. They were cheerful and friendly and extrememely helpful with suggestions of where to eat for lunch and offering to make a reservation for dinner in North Boston for us. We booked a Premire Family Suite with two bedrooms. The rooms were just beautiful and decorated with total class. Each bedroom was huge with a hallway between the two with the bathroom door located in the middle. The bathroom was small, but it did the job. Obviously you won't be spending most of your time in there so what's the difference really! Everything was clean and well maintained. I can't attest to how big the regular rooms are, but although it was expensive (what hotel in Boston isn't?) I would get the same room again. A must if you are staying with older kids. Free WiFi for all and the kids were thrilled. There is a very busy nightclub in the lobby that seemed to be filled with very fashionable upscale college aged crowd. Loved the place and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Deals Too Good To Be True”
Reviews.Author: stacksEriePa
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity to stay for several nights recently. Hotel is really phenomenal, contemporary, and a GREAT location. Our room however was the size of a closet with a basic furniture in the room making it nearly impossible for people to pass each other navigating the room. To enter the bathroom you had to pass by the door, open it, then enter depending upon which side of the bed you were approaching from. The bathroom could be defined as an excellent use of space, provided you were 4' tall. Sitting on the commode, my knees actually touched the wall immediately in front of me. When I addressed my displeasure with the accommodations with the manager on duty, he quickly spouted of a square footage requirement of the room with a pompous snooty attitude like it was a daily practice. There were NO free options to correct the situation other than a paid upgrade on top of the significant parking fees. Significant street noise around 2AM ... but it is the city. Also a lot of hallway noise penetrating the door. What can I say, for that kind money and environment, the staff attitude was a real turn off! Considering the glut of rooms in the city right now, I would elsewhere in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money disguised as trendy”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_Nomad22
Reviews.Content: On a business trip I stayed at this hotel. Admittedly I thought I was staying at one of the better known hotels in the area. Note that I am a business traveller coming to Boston from Europe and I am on the road over 200 days a year so my experience base is pretty rich. This is the worse value for money I have experiences. I paid $326 per night. Lobby was very trendy as would be expected from a recently renovated hotel.....but nobody was there to check me in (and by the way nobody was there to check me out the next day either). Room was okay (not execeptional which this price would justify) but I had to turn sideways to get into the bathroom shower!!! I would expect this in Europe but not the US. As an overseas traveller I woke at 4 am and wanted to order coffee but guess what room service only works from 6h30 to 23h00. Once I did get my small pot of coffee with a glass of low fat milk it was $20!!!! Are you kidding me!!! In short what happens when you try to be and think you are trendy but are just an overpriced badly managed hotel???????? hopefully you do not get guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent All Rounder! Outstanding Service.”
Reviews.Author: CB_Aberdeen
Reviews.Content: We were stranded in the USA because of the Volcano and decided to book in Boston (as we had been in NYC). From checkin through to departure the service we received was OUTSTANDING -above and beyond what we have experienced elsewhere. The reception staff were knowledgeable and friendly, the lobby was very classy, maid staff were excellent too. The hotel is boutique style and had recently undergone huge investement. Very nice comfortable rooms, complimentary bottled watter, complimentary coffee in the morning, complimentary wine pour between 5-6pm. The hotel is right next to Boston Public Library where ypu can register for free web use. It is also next to the Prudential centre/shops and a supermarket (if you need to save a few pennies on food etc!). This is a great hotel in a great location with great staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cpaineau
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Copley Square Hotel for 3 nights and had an excellent stay. Very friendly staff. Great locations. Very nice rooms, clean and comfortable. Just minutes to the main Boston attractions. Close to South End and Back Bay restaurants. We would definately stay there again if we go back to Boston. Very quick check in and even quicker check out.

Reviews.Title: “A New Favorite”
Reviews.Author: snowpeas
Reviews.Content: From the minute of our check-in at the Copley Square Hotel to the minute of our check-out, we were impressed with the stellar service of those in the hotel's employ. Although we have stayed in numerous hotels, we have yet to experience a more appropriately attentive, professionally polished staff. In their courtesy, efficiency, and helpfulness, they were flawless. Although we were told that our room was the smallest in the hotel, we found the room so well designed that its smallness was not problematic. The room was a pleasant combination of old charm and modern elegance. The moldings and doors exhibited years of layered paint while the furnishings boasted a contemporary design. Laid at the foot of the bed was a tray with both practical and whimsical pamphlets. Behind one door was an ample closet with an iron and ironing board; behind another door was a beautiful and roomy bathroom with stylish fixtures and plenty of thick towels. Toiletries could be placed on a three-tiered glass shelf. A newspaper was placed outside the door each morning. Rather than the box-like uniformity of newer hotels, Copley Square Hotel exhibited a refreshing blend of varying angles and passageways. A carpeted stairway with wooden banisters stood between two glossy elevators; the hallways were attractively fashioned. As a boutique hotel, the downstairs decor was wonderfully chic. The restaurant served breakfast and dinner. The bar hosted a nightly crowd of young adults. However, we chose the quieter and more intimate seating provided in the subdued tones and darkened hues of the lobby. The desk clerk not only retrieved a menu from the bar, but he also arranged to have our food served where we were seated on a comfortable couch. Complimentary wine was poured for an hour in the evening, and guests were readily offered refills. It was a perfect place to retreat and relax. In the mornings, coffee was available until 11:00. The location of the hotel was ideal. Within easy walking distance was the Boston Public Library, the Back Bay train station, the subway, the grocery store, a large mall with many floors, as well as numerous shops and eateries. To speak of the hotel, we have to use superlatives. We absolutely loved the Copley Square Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place. Super close to Library and shopping.”
Reviews.Author: alpha5280
Reviews.Content: Right next to the Mall and the Boston Public Library. Very convenient to get to both locations. Lobby and public areas very modern and classy. Beds very comfortable. Restaurant and bar on property. Bottom of the line room was very small but still classy, very clean, and had a closet. Heating was loud when it came on, but almost no noise from other rooms could be heard. Disappointed that room service stopped at 11 pm but staff gave me two delivery fliers and was able to order from one of them until 3 am. Quite a bit less expensive than other hotels I checked in Copley Square.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mustluvdogs9
Reviews.Content: Service was overall fine. Staff wasn't over the top nice, but they were fine. I needed a late checkout (later than noon), and they gave me 1pm. Not great, but at least they helped out. The room was nice, the bed was comfortable. The bathroom sink was really tiny so not much room for toiletries. It's a really old hotel that was recently redone, so some things were reminiscent of the fact that it is an old building, like the moldings, but that's ok. It was definitely a charming little hotel. It has a fitness center with two treadmills and two ellipticals and that was really convenient. The location is fantastic - right around the corner from Copley Station, and literally next door to Copley Mall. Just great location. Overall we had a great stay, and I would stay here again! Also there is a bar off of the lobby called miniBar I think, and while we didn't get to go there at all, it was JAMMING every night - looked like the place to be, and is probably great in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the decor but not the amenities.”
Reviews.Author: FanOfGoodService
Reviews.Content: Place is lovely, but a series of goof-ups overshawdowed the chic look. One immediate turn off--you cannot get a fresh cup of coffee at the hotel between lunch and dinner service. Also, ordered in-room breakfast and it arrived 30 minutes late. Sadly, had to leave for my first meeting of the day without tasting it...and with out a cup of coffee to get me going. On arrival--at about 2pm--I was told that no food was available because the kitchen is not open during the afternoon. Had been traveling all day and needed some refreshment before an early evening meeting. Because there are no mini-bars in the room, there wasn't even the option to grab a coke or some chips. Had to walk down the road to supermarket and get something there (woman at desk who recommended this was nice and in general the staff was very pleasant). Free glass of wine at 5pm was nice, tho the environment was stiff and surprisingly inelegant given the marketing of the place. Wanted to love this place, but little details--like access to food, coffee and timely room service--are important when you are traveling on business.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Choice in Boston's Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: anitajd
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent a weekend in March at the Copley Square Hotel for a "mom's weekend away." The rate we got for our room was outstanding--Boston in the "off season."! The hotel is very contemporary, having Reception "pods" and "intuition specialists." The staff was very friendly and helpful. The nightly wine reception is a very nice touch. The decor is very chic. The room was a bit tight with 2 double beds, but those beds were extremely comfortable!! The bathroom was a great size, too. I liked the little touches the hotel offered, including the free wi-fi, the "Today and Tomorrow" feature listing, and the "Bedtime Stories." The location was excellent for us--lots of shopping, dining, and areas to walk. My one complaint is that I think our room (room #314) was directly above the bar/club. On Saturday night, I was kept up from 12am-2am from excessive noise. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “boston”
Reviews.Author: TanyaW2
Reviews.Content: great location,close to eating and shopping and right in the heart of everything.updated yet historical.classic and easy to get a cab. can walk to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel in a GREAT Location!”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler1983
Reviews.Content: The Copley Square Hotel has a great location in Boston's Back Bay. It is in close proximity to the Marriott and Westin and for me, that was critical as I was in Boston to attend a convention being held at both the Marriott and the Westin. The hotel is within very easy walking distance to plenty of shopping along Boyston Avenue and Newbury Street. There are also tons of shops at the Prudential Center. The rooms are small but that is to be expected in such a historic hotel and as I was rooming alone, I had plenty of room. The area is thriving and there are lots of options for entertainment and the staff is quite happy to help. I plan to stay here again when I return to Boston next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice in Boston's Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: GreenTraveler9
Reviews.Content: I like small hotels with character and an attentive, friendly staff, and the Copley Square turned out to be a great choice. The rooms are generally well appointed and comfortable (mine lacked a small refrigerator or coffee maker). It was slightly noisy at times from plumbing or the hotel's heating system, but this was only a minor annoyance. I'm usually not a person who hangs out in hotel lobby's, but the Copley Square's is striking and comfortable, a place where it was fun to sit and read and drink coffee on a sunny Boston day. Staff was very helpful and responsive when I needed assistance. Excellent restaurant. Also, it's a short walk to two different subway stops and right in the heart of the Back Bay commercial district. I'd happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Copley Square!”
Reviews.Author: morr88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Copley Square for one night in January and one night in February of 2010. Both of our stays were excellent. Before traveling to Boston, my husband was in contact with the hotel staff looking for suggestions and recommendations for entertainment. The hotel manager went out of his way to help, and was quick to respond to all emails. Parking in the garage is quite pricey ($40/night?) but both times we were able to find a spot right on the street. We had to feed the meter every 2 hours until 7:00, but it was worth it. The beds at the Copley couldn't be more comfortable. I would love to have one here at home! The rooms are small, but more than adequate for one couple. The bathrooms were very clean, had fluffy towels and plenty of counter space. The only complaint we had was during our second stay. We had upgraded to a premier edge room which overlooked two city streets, and the room was quite chilly, even though we were able to control our own thermostat. (There were a lot of windows with great views, but we had to keep the drapes shut in order to keep out drafts.) The hotel has some nice on-site entertainment. The Mini-bar is quite trendy and has great cocktails. It reaches capacity quickly on the weekends, so go early. The restaurant was beautifully appointed and had good food. There is a nightclub in the basement of the hotel. It also got quite crowded, even though there are several rooms. I'd recommend this spot to younger adults. We 40-somethings felt a bit out of place! The Prudential Shopping Center is one block away, and there is a 24 hour Shaws grocery store right next door - perfect for a midnight snack run! We'll definitely return to the Copley Square!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel / GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: ishakil
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel only one night because I was in town for an interview. In the morning, I realized that I failed to pack a tie and that I was running late for my interview. Buck, at the Front Desk, actually let me borrow one of his ties... which he happened to have stowed in the back. Everything worked out great. The tie was perfectly suitable! When I returned, he left me a personal hand-written message that wished me good luck on my interview. GREAT SERVICE!!

Reviews.Title: “A great Boston experience”
Reviews.Author: I-veritas
Reviews.Content: I can confirm what other reviews have consistently stated, The Copley Square Hotel is a great place to stay! I arrived in Boston on a chilly and wet evening but was given the warmest reception by a charming young chap called Ryan at the reception. I had booked here as a second choice (I originally wanted to stay at the Fairmont Copley Plaza but was not prepared to pay the ridicuous single room supplement) and was prepared for a smallish room. I was offered an upgrade for what amounted to Â£9pn inc taxes and I am so glad I took it....the room was absolutely beautiful, as someone with very similar taste in my own home I appreciated the decor. Apart from being huge (it was a corner room) and well furnished the 6' bed is one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Overall it was great value and I appreciated not having to pay the premium associated with upkeeping garndiose public rooms. The reception staff are very young - probably all in their early 20s - but have a real professionalism and committment to customer satisfaction, although I didn't take advantage of this from the range of services on offer it would appear that nothing was too much trouble. The wine tasting was a nice touch after a long day of sightseeing but in truth would probably not impress a connoisseur. The Copley Square Hotel has a great location, withn the close vicinity to the Fairmont, Weston, Marriot and Lennox within a stone's throw of Copley T. Everything in Boston and Cambridge is within walking distance (I walked to Harvard and back via the MFA but the average tourist might prefer not to!!), Boston offers so much history, entertainment, nice restaurants etc and is an ideal place for a clutural break. Did I mention the shopping?? - plenty along Boyston Avenue and Newbury Street but best of all the shops at the Prudential Centre are a real bonus. If you like to be looked after in welcoming surroundings with minimum intrusion, this hotel comes with the highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek surprise”
Reviews.Author: TravelChannelCMB
Reviews.Content: I book a lot of hotels on a somewhat small budget for my job. There's always pressure to stay somewhere slightly cheaper, as we're out of the room for nearly all of our stay. The Copley Square Hotel has been the first place I've traveled on business where I wish I could've taken fuller advantage of all the hotel had to offer. The lobby is impressive and well maintained, and we received excellent service during check in and from the valet. For such a swanky neighborhood, I was surprised by how affordable our rooms were, and the quality of the amenities. The decor is beautiful and I have no complaints about cleanliness. The rooms aren't huge (we travel with a lot of a equipment, which made for a tight squeeze) but a couple with a few suitcases wouldn't find them claustrophobic. There's a nice sized desk across from the comfortable bed and the flat screen TV is on the amoire to the side- slightly inconvenient for watching from bed. The bathroom was small but in excellent condition, and the added touches of an iHome clock/radio/iPod dock (always turned on during turn down) and complimentary bottled water were appreciated. We didn't get the chance to experience the bars, nightclub or Wine Down features of this hotel, but our knowlegeable and attentive server at the restaurant kept with my positive impression of the place. I'd definitely stay here again on a romantic weekend- it's conveniently located and was a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy well placed hotel”
Reviews.Author: IONACARR
Reviews.Content: We stayed in family suite, which comprised of two double rooms beautifully decorated and shared one minute but fuctioning bathroom. The rooms were a good size and as we paid $249 a night for this 4 star boutique hotel, I thought this was particularly good value. The bar in the foyer was buzzy and served trendy mini tapas style foods.

Reviews.Title: “very impressed”
Reviews.Author: booker41020
Reviews.Content: Came up to Boston for Valentine's weekend with my boyfriend, could not be more impressed with this hotel and i have traveled all over the world. This was by FAR the best boutique hotel I've ever stayed at. The staff was amazingly helpful and friendly, even gave us a map of local attractions upon check in. The hotel was SUPER clean with trendy decor. We stayed in the Premier King room, which had a nice big bathroom (it is on the corner so maybe this is why) and the bed was very comfortable. The room also included an iHome radio/alarm which to me is fabulous so you can plug your ipod right into it to charge or wake up to. There is a great bar in the lobby that was packed on a Saturday night, as well as a lounge downstairs that included 2 different rooms, one was more hip hop and the other was pop/dance music. Hotel guests get in for free and drinks were reasonable. Having the 2 options for nightlife in one place made it very convenient especially if you didn't know the area well. Location is excellent, Newbury street is 2 blocks away with blocks and blocks of stores and restaurants. I highly recommend one called Tapeo if you enjoy Spanish Tapas, very amazing and price point was low. I will definitely be staying at this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location. Had a Fabulous time.”
Reviews.Author: nenornchik
Reviews.Content: I want to point out the important parts of our trip because these were the things that sold me on this hotel and this location. Sorry it's a little long but a review is what sold me on this hotel. **The T -- First and foremost take advantage of the T. No need for cabs in Boston when they have an amazing subway system and very clean and very safe. So if you've never been to a city with a subway have no fear. This was our first trip to Boston. We stayed 4 days and wish we had stayed a week. Get to know the T before you go so you know where to get off when you leave the airport. There is a bus that will take you from the airport to the T station, if you can't find it when you get off the plane, ask somebody, they will help you. We got off at Copley and when you get out of the station at the street level, cross the street, walk in front of the library, turn the corner up to Huntington Ave and the Copley Square Hotel will be right in front of you. Don't worry if you don't see the sign, it's on the other side. **The Hotel -- The hotel was amazing. It is a very old hotel that has been completely remodeled and is very modern. I really liked the feel of it because it was a more intimate setting. They do have 2 elevators so if you get on the small one don't worry that's the original one which I thought was very cool, the larger one is right across from it. The hallways are long windy and narrow, which again I thought was very cool because this was original. The rooms were smaller than normal hotel rooms you might get at the Marriott but once again this is an older hotel that has been remodeled. Furthermore, there is so much to do in Boston that we didn't waste any time in the room except to sleep and shower. The bathrooms were very clean and modern. I read several reviews about this hotel before we went and every one of them mentioned the size of the room but who cares? If I wanted to stay in a big room I would stay at home. The hotel staff was nothing but polite and helpful. The turndown service was great. If you want to get out and do things ask the hotel staff downstairs and they will point you in the right direction. There is room service in the hotel but if you don't want to spend that kind of money there is a grocery store right next door that had everything in it and it is open 24 hours a day. There is also a Walgreens a block away. We couldn't have picked a better location because it is smack dab in the middle of everything. You can still go to Fenway, or to the Harbour, and you can walk just about anywhere as well. There is a bar/club downstairs that is quite the happening place at night and a lot of reviews mentioned it being loud and the street noise being loud, but honestly I didn't notice. We went in the bar once but it was very pricey. Wine and beer was much cheaper at any restaurant in the area. **Sightseeing -- If you've never been to Boston and want to get a good tour take the Old Town Sightseeing Tour. (the orange and green trolley) When you walk out of the hotel go to your right and cross the street over to the Marriott Copley. There is a ticket booth in the lobby where you can buy the tickets to the trolley and they pick up every 10 mins at that location. The trolley takes you all over the city and tells you everything about it. The thing that I liked the most was you could get off at any one of the 15 stops and go off on your own and then come back to the stop and get back on. Another trolley shows up at every stop every 10 mins so no matter where you were you could back on any trolley throughout the day with your ticket. This was also a good way for us to get a ride over to Fenway when we went to the game that night. **Fenway -- If you're a baseball fan, and even if you're not this is a must! I'm a huge Red Sox fan, and my husband is a huge Yankees fan, so it was pertinent that we go to a RedSox/Yankees game. And it was amazing. Fenway is the oldest park in the country and there is so much history there. Anybody who loves sports this is a sight to see.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: xperiencedtraveller
Reviews.Content: I have been trying to figure out how to write this review. The hotel was clean, the employees were pleasant, the turn down service was nice with a little paper review of weather for the next day. The room we were in was small on the top floor - but cozy. Bathroom was small but no big deal once you squeezed round the door.... There was just nothing exceptional about the stay, or staff, or room, everything was just fine. If i go back to Boston again I think I would like to try a different hotel - not because it was bad but because there was nothing memoriable about the stay to make me a loyal customer. Oh and at night there is noise, as a heavy sleeper I heard nothing but my husband mentioned a couple of things to me in the morning - so if you are a very light sleeper I suggest you go to a different part of town. Also if you are coming from the airport take the tube - you can get anywhere for $2 and its really easy to navigate around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: The_Traveller_I
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very confortable and has the best location. Rooms are not vey large but are ok for the purpose. The service is very good, and very convenient with free coffee in the mornig and a happy hour (free wine) on the afternoon. I shall stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bg217
Reviews.Content: Booked a deal through Priceline for under $100 -- pleased with the deal we got. Great location for our needs, staff was attentive. We wanted a room with two beds and were offered one for $25 more a night. This seemed like a lot, and we hesitated -- clerk eventually offered it to us for $20. It was worth it for us, but we still felt nickled and dimed. Website states that they have coffee, tea, and hot chocolate 24 hours a day in the lobby -- this was not true at all. Coffee was out till 11am, and then I was offered to buy some in the restaurant. Disappointing for a heavy coffee drinker :) Other than those quibbles, it was a great stay and the staff was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, close to everything, boston is a great city just like the hotel itself!”
Reviews.Author: gerrypolo
Reviews.Content: this was the first time i visited boston. I'd been to new york, washington and las vegas before, so i expected alot from the city. The hotel was lovely, i can not say anything wrong about it. At night when we returned, the heating was on, our beds were turned down and the radio was turned on. The room was cleaned brilliantly everyday and the staff were so polite and helpfull! The hotel is brilliantly located close to the prudential center and newbury street-where there are plenty of stores. A T stop is just around the corner as too is John Hancock Tower and the Boston city Library. Macys and other stores are a 20 minute walk away in chinatown-however, a walk to these is a pleasure, as the streets are wider and less crowed then those in New York. We came to boston to do some shopping, and it proved fruitful. My wife found the shopping to be better then that in NY, especially as no sales tax was put on the majority of our spending(clothes).

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN BOSTON”
Reviews.Author: MD0726
Reviews.Content: Best hotel in Boston. Excellent staff and service! This hotel made me feel like home! The hotel is so clean! I stayed in several hotels over the years but this hotel had to be one of the best. I recommend this hotel to any travelers that stay in Boston. If you want to feel like home in a hotel on vacation this is the hotel to spend the night in..

Reviews.Title: “We could have done better for the same money”
Reviews.Author: DonaldFagen
Reviews.Content: Great location steps away from the Prudential Center. Low rise hotel meant you could hear street noise. Old building re-done in a modern style. Rooms were clean, down comforters that were too warm with AC that would not go below 65. Staff was extremely kind and welcoming and professional in every way. No vending machines in this hotel at all, so bring your own mixers. In the end we could have stayed at a few other hotels for the same money had had nicer room and better experience. Priceline lists this as a four star hotel. I'd say 2.5 stars. But again the hotel staff we interacted with were as nice as one could find. Great people, nothing great about the property itself. and, anticipate the $42 valet parking or $39 in the garage at the Pru.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay Was Perfect. Outstanding Service and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Continental American
Reviews.Content: The Copley Square Hotel has been newly re-invented into a sophisticated contemporary hotel. The service is outstanding, and every staff member I encountered was polite, friendly and had a very positive attitude about the hotel and what they could do to make the guests enjoy their stay. This is so different from many large hotels where you check in and never see anyone unless you have a problem. I enjoyed their daily wine receptions in the lobby where various wines were served in beautiful stemware in a relaxing setting. This was just a nice feature. Nobody was trying to sell you cases of wine or anything like that. There were so many nice things about this hotel. There was free coffee in the lobby in the morning, a newspaper delivered during weekdays, turndown service in the evening with information left about the following day's weather and things to do in the city. Free bottled water was left in the evening, and the wifi worked very well in my room and in the lobby. The toiletries in the bathroom were of good quality and nicely scented - the kind you actually wanted to use and take home extras. Although there is a nightclub and popular bar on the ground floor, my room was perfectly silent for the whole week I was there. There was no noise whatsoever from music in the club or other guests, If you want a quiet room at this hotel, you can definitely have one. I didn't get to try the restaurant for dinner, although it looked attractive and welcoming. I did have a selection of appetizers and some wine for dinner one stormy night at their bar called "Minibar", and it was a really nice time. Minibar is a very trendy and popular place with the local people especially on the weekend. The room was very nicely decorated, and the bed was very comfortable. The furniture was new and fine quality. The bathroom had a powerful shower with abundant hot water and bathtub. There were lots of big towels. Everything was extremely clean and fresh. I believe I had the minimum rate room, and some may consider it small compared to others they stayed in, but it was fine for me. There seem to be various other rooms available at higher prices that would probably be larger with views etc. This hotel is perfectly located in what is probably the best part of Boston. I felt totally safe walking day and night. There are many shops and restaurants of all kinds within minutes of the hotel. There are two subway lines very close to the hotel making it easy to get anywhere in the city very quickly. This is my new favorite hotel in Boston, and I look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: irlhelen
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the positive reviews here. The staff were extremely friendly. The ambiance of the hotel is very "cool," but that didn't stop the reception from greeting us warmly. I had emailed them before to let them know that I was allergic to down feathers - I've had bad experiences before with down pillows in some of the more trendy hotels. They not only had gotten my email, but also had given us all hypoallergenic bedding and linen. Very thoughtful. We arrived by Amtrak and the hotel is only about 2 minutes from the Back Bay station. Very convenient. We didn't eat breakfast there so I cannot comment on the food or the free wine reception. The only down sides as far as we were concerned were the lack of a computer available for guests (although they do have free wi-fi in the rooms) and the dimly lit rooms. If you need the computer and don't have a laptop, the hotel is right around the corner from the main Boston Public Library. They have 15-minute free access to computers/internet without having to have a library card. Overall, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: ClementKHL
Reviews.Content: Delicately designed rooms and good services. Only the bathroom is too small.

Reviews.Title: “All-Around Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: cboyden
Reviews.Content: As a native New Englander, I have stayed at many hotels in Boston. I hadn't been to the Copley Square in years, but I heard the renovation was great, so figured we'd give it a try. From the moment we checked in, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is very chic, a great find in Back Bay! The rooms are very modern and a great size...and Wine Down in the lobby is a nice way to spend happy hour - the staff mingles with guests and truly makes you feel welcome...and the location is perfect! We will definitely be back next time we are in Boston - it is a 10!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: kdet
Reviews.Content: I had to do a lot of research to find a modern, boutique style hotel in Boston and found this one through other people's reviews. The hotel is very nice and did not disappoint us. The staff tried extra hard to give good service. They were very good at remembering our names and sincerely tried to make our stay as nice as possible. In the evening, they offer (free) wine tasting which we really enjoyed. Lots of guests came down so I'd have to say it's a nice perk. The location is really close to some great seafood restaurants as well as Copley Plaza so it was very convenient for us. Otherwise the other reviews are pretty accurate so we knew to expect the hotel to be noisy. It's just noise from the street because the location is so central. So nothing that ear plugs couldn't block out so that was not a major issue for us.

Reviews.Title: “Older Boutique Hotel with Mixed Service”
Reviews.Author: gradlife79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Copley Square for a business trip to the Boston area. The renovations make it a nice hotel with wonderful service in the XHALE restaurant and free wireless (that actually works) in the rooms. Being an older hotel the rooms were smaller with some problems with noise and insulation, specifically with the windows. The one sore point was finding on the last day that I was overbilled for breakfast, which I had to argue to have corrected. The rep at the counter asked to take my number soo his manager could look into it and call me back in the evening AFTER I left the hotel. Also, the gym is quite limited (4 cardio machines, some free weights up to 50 lb, one machine, and an incline bench), which is a big deal for me with longer stays, although they do offer access to a larger gym at the Prudential for $15. Overall, it is a charming hotel with an awesome location and mostly good customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Our new home in Boston”
Reviews.Author: wintertraveler05
Reviews.Content: We used to stay at another nearby hotel but their room costs are constantly going up so we decided for a little more money to try Copley Square Hotel. Glad we did. We used to stay here before the renovations and now the hotel is so much better. Every staff member is friendly and helpful. (Thanks Rene!) Our room was decorated very contemporary. It was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was a bit tight and their was no place to put toiletries. The complimentary wine hour was a special treat. The downstairs bar off the lobby was very busy and noisy. Overall our stay was excellent and we will definitely be staying here for every Boston trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PCBSML
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Copley Square for parent's weekend. We loved the renovated building, our room with three bay windows, and the decor in general. The staff were welcoming and helpful. The location can't be beat, right in Copley Square with lots of shops, restaurants, and a T stop steps away. Our only complaint was the now ubiquitous "Hang towels you want to re-use...." , which we fully support, but there were no towel racks in the bathroom! Hard to hang towels in such a situation.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - this is a special hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: LJTD
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent - we turned up soaked through from torrential rain and the staff offered us towels and hot chocolate. The room was great - decent size, massive bed, very comfortable. Location is ideal. There is a restaurant, fitness centre and bar, unfortunately none of which we had the chance to try out. It's not cheap, but it is definitely special!

Reviews.Title: “Angels vs. Red Sox”
Reviews.Author: Lpguereca
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Boston was incredible! The staff at the Copley Square Hotel was great...very nice people! We arrived at the hotel at a bit past 7am and were surprised to find that our room was ready for us. The room, although a bit small, was very pretty and very clean!! The staff was easy to contact and eager to please. We enjoyed the daily list of attractions provided by the hotel. We arrived in Boston with a mission! A mission to see the Angels beat the Red Sox. And....well, we won 1 of the games. Fenway Park was very close to the hotel...perfect for us! Trinity Church was right across the street and the Public Garden was a short walk away. Once we learned the streets...we realized that everything is within walking distance except Harvard. We took the subway to get there. Overall, we had a great time in Boston. Spent lots of time at Fenway, ate some great food and experienced the history of the city and our country. We will be visiting Boston again next year! We wouldn't stay anywhere else than the Copley Square Hotel. Great place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Kathylee
Reviews.Content: Goregous hotel with lots of history. We were upgraded to a suite and it was huge. We were very happy and wish we could've stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Beware TEENY rooms”
Reviews.Author: Notantherhotel
Reviews.Content: Booked on Priceline - got the room for $140 which is not so great for Priceline. When I checked in I asked if I could have 2 beds - and I could - for an additional $30 per night. I declined - but quickly changed my mind when I saw the size of the King room I was assigned. It was easily the smallest hotel room I've ever seen. I've been to NYC, Paris, London, etc. & know how small a room can be in a large city. This was a new level of tiny. I quickly went downstairs & paid the additional $$ to upgrade (first time I've ever been charged additional fees to upgrade - usually it's complimentary - & I doubt the hotel was full based on the lack of a crowd throughout stay). The second room worked - large enough. The location is the selling point of this hotel - 2 blocks from Newbury St., close to subway, restaurants, etc. Parking is a JOKE at $42 per night. You can park across the street at the Prudential center for $39 a night but good luck negotiating the maze of parking levels. Overall, the hotel is a good value if you book on Priceline. I wouldn't feel comfortable paying the rack rate, however. It's been remodeled & has character, but it's still rough around the edges. I would consider staying there again if I scored a deal, otherwise I'd look elsewhere for a nicer option.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjkh55
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at this hotel. Beautifully furnished, as was our 4th floor room. The mattress comforter and comfy pillows made for a relaxing nights sleep. The bottles of water delivered to your room every evening and a free newspaper delivered every morning were nice touches as was the invitation to a wine tasting in the lounge every evening between 5 pm and 6 pm. Breakfast was delicious - especially the waffles. The front desk staff were so friendly and helpful and went that extra mile to make your stay more pleasant. The hotel is centrally located and within easy reach of most attractions. There is a very comfortable relaxed feel to the hotel. Loved everything about it.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish renovation in central Boston”
Reviews.Author: eeleeleel
Reviews.Content: We found Copley Square online and booked an early bird special for a one-night stay in Boston. The reservations team was so thorough beforehand, sending emails to see if we had special requests or other needs. Upon arriving in Boston, the hotel was easy to find and centrally located. Valet and the bellhops were prompt. Our room was very well appointed. It was tiny and looked onto an air shaft, but that's what you get for a great low rate, I suppose! The square footage of each class of room is mentioned on the website, actually; I must not have been paying attention. The bed was incredibly comfortable, so much so that we spent the next morning in bed reading the paper. The linens were soft and the pillows amazing. The bathroom was large in comparison to the room and had soft towels and nice products. It's the updated original. Hit the gym, which was fine: one flat screen tv and good machines. The hotel is a gorgeous historic property in an overdeveloped area. It's chain hotels and a mall and chain restaurants wall-to-wall. To escape this problem, we walked everywhere: to the Public Gardens, part of the Freedom Trail, Beacon Hill, the New England Aquarium, and later, to Tremont Street, for incredible oysters at B + G and then an insanely good dinner (and wine) at The Butcher Shop, a few doors down. When we got back, our room had been turned down beautifully. All in all, a good hotel with caring management.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: LondonChantalB
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in the city centre, within easy reach of some of the best shopping in Boston! We got a great room, a premier double double, which was really spacious. This was a pleasant surprise because I noticed some earlier reviews said that the rooms were small. They also mentioned that it could get really noisy in the early hours as people left the nightclub and bar attached to the hotel. I must say this was not an issue for us, we didn't find it that noisy at all and we stayed Friday to Sunday. In fact we used our VIP passes to visit the nightclub, which was fun and part of our experience of the hotel! The staff were very helpful, professional and friendly, and eager to make our stay as comfortable as possible. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Boston be it for business or leisure. I will certainly revisit this hotel when I return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless! Great location, great staff, great room”
Reviews.Author: DCHane
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our 20th anniversary -- I surprised my wife with a trip to Boston, where we fell in love. I wanted every detail of the weekend to be perfect, and it was. I made a few unusual requests about setting up the room prior to our arrival (I wanted an early checkin, a nice room, and a letter to my wife that I sent in advance left prominently on the bed). I really didn't expect the hotel to pull it all together, but they did. Our room was outstanding and the staff was always helpful but never in the way. WiFi worked great, even in our room at the end of the hall (that's unusual). A great value and an excellent alternative to generic big chain monstrosities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Stevenspoint
Reviews.Content: Service was Excellent. Renovation of hotel was extremely well done. Convenient location and noticable efforts to be friendly to the environment. Would recommend this property without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Boutique Hotel in amazing location - Plenty of 'Intuition'!”
Reviews.Author: gcoopernyc
Reviews.Content: Just returned for a 3 night stay at the Copley and loved every minute of it. From the 'intuition specialist' assisting us even though we had a late check in to the water bottles that are delivered to the room every night - they really have thought of everything. The food at Xhale was very nice, especially breakfast, which was the usual Boston portions! Room was very clean and I loved the orange scented toiletries - wish they had been bigger bottles to take home. Very close to the T line and round the corner from Newbury Street and all the great restaurants there. Overall, I loved the feeling I was not in a bog standard hotel and loved the attention to detail, even down to the wallpapar - just as a true boutique hotel should.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Boston thanks to the Copley Square Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ReadHere
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights. Got a great deal, 4 nights for the price of 3, and a $100 credit for the restaurant. All the staff are friendly and helpful. The MiniBar is their bar just off the lobby, and is a major hot spot for Boston. Great atmosphere in the MiniBar, especially if you are single! The restaurant served a terrific basic menu for dinner (Gordon Ramsay would be pleased). Breakfast was a la carte, no buffet, but for less than $15 you could put together a great breakfast. Lox and bagel platter was superb; so were the waffles and omelets. The 2 gentlemen and the lady who worked the breakfast service were wonderful. Room and bathroom size were fine, with the nicest of everything. Free WiFi everywhere was a nice touch. Good workout room. Perfect location at the corner of Huntington and Exeter. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: familyhols9
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderful stay here,loved everything about the hotel,great location ,great staff especially the restraunt staff,and the family rooms we had were beautfully decorated and spotlessly clean,will use next time we get back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Bobbobsexy99
Reviews.Content: Staff was VERY helpful and accommodating of a sick friend. They also did not charge me extra when my one-person room ended up being crashing space for 6 people. However, for $180/night I expected bigger. I had a room at the end of a hallway, and it was angled awkwardly. I have stayed at 3 other surrounding hotels, and they were all bigger and cheaper.
